text: Went for breakfast today for the first time. I had the steak with egg whites, hash browns and a biscuit.  The steak was juicy and tender.  I usually ask for my hash browns to be well done but not here.  They were crunchy on the top just right in the middle.  The way I like them.  New spot definitely.

Terrace Cafe is wonderful place for brunch. My husband took me for my birthday brunch and we had lovely time. It was weekend so we had to wait for sometime before we got seating but trust me it was worth the wait. We ate so much we could hardly move :) I guess this is best way to celebrate birthday! I loved their famous Red Velvet Waffles. Great Service and great food!

My wife and I love this place.  We go at least 3 times a month for breakfast.  The food is always delicious and timely.  The kitchen staff is top notch. The waitstaff is very professional and friendly.  We highly recommend.

Kids favorite of all brunch/breakfast places we have been.  Had eggs Benedict, quite good! At our table we ordered waffles.  Blueberry pancakes and a order of French toast.   Oj fresh squeezed.  Coffee excellent
We ave been here for breakfast and dinner several times.  It's really good food and really creative.  Family friendly too.

Very disappointed in all of the food that myself . Visiting Charlotte for the weekend  and wasted my time at this place. The only reason they received two stars one for the hostess and the Cupcake Latte I ordered. The food was awful I spent $50 bucks for two people and neither one of us really enjoyed anything. It was hard to see all the people lined up to get Inside and not tell them how the food taste... While i did NOT any eggs I didn't not have to. This place did not make the cut!!!

My family and I went to the Terrace Cafe for the first time. When we arrived we were told the wait would be around 35 minutes. We weighed our options and decided to stay. It was very cold and rainy so we waited right inside the cafe. As we were waiting we noticed that the seating arrangements made no sense. They seated two people at a table for four, when a family of four had been waiting for a while. They did this multiple times then had to push two tables together to seat families of three or four. We also had to ask if our table was ready as it had been over 35 minutes. Once seated, our waiter quickly introduced himself and asked for our drink order. Next, he asked for our meal order. Our food came quite quickly, and it tasted pretty good. My older sister ordered pancakes, and was very impressed. My younger sister ordered two animal pancakes, an egg, and bacon. She was also very happy. Both my parents ordered chicken and waffles, and enjoyed the food as well. I ordered a red velvet waffle with a side of grits and bacon. While the food was good, it was not amazing. Enjoyed the experience but the 35 minute wait was not quite worth the food.
Could not even eat the egg whites because they were so oily! Gross! Don't think I will order from here again...

It's busy, but once you get tagged "Best Breakfast in Charlotte" you'd expect that. Exceptional coffee, food, ambiance, and service!!! Top notch!!! It is all well worth the wait....and yes the red velvet waffle was that good! : )

Food is really good.  But, the service is extremely slow. For some reason, they have difficulty with large groups.  Strange for a breakfast and brunch restaurant.  If you have plenty of time and don't mind a long wait, this is definitely a great option.  If you have a group of six or more, call ahead.

I was staying nearby and wanted a yummy spot for breakfast, yelp told me this was a good spot. I was not disappointed. I was there around 9am on a weekday, so not very busy. All the staff were super friendly and accommodating. I really like how the menu has some funny, quirky items, like the red velvet waffle (what I had and holey-moley was it awesome!), the banana split yogurt parfait, and a chocolate covered cherry latte. The food was very good and service great. When I told my server I thought the latte was not flavored enough, she took it back and added more syrup.  There was a lot of seating, but I could see why this place might get packed with people at peak times. I will be going back here again the next time I am in Charlotte for sure!

Whenever I'm in Charlotte I like to visit local spots like this due to the lack of non-chain restaurants in the queen city. Stopped by on a week night wasn't packed at all. Decided to try something new off the menu, squash ravioli which was really good, the dessert was even better.   Many are aware of Terrace Cafe excellent breakfast (served all day) but the lunch and dinner selections are worth the try. The service was great as always. Our waiter definitely made the right recommendations. The laid back atmosphere, on this night was a plus the lights were dim throughout the restaurant which made me look forward to coming back.
Red velvet waffles and chicken was a good portion and very delicious, I will definitely keep this on my favorite food list. Staff was attentive and setting was nice.

I decided to start writing reviews again. Here is the first one.  Not sure if the restaurant's name changed. I ate at Terrace restaurant for lunch 4 weeks ago while in town.   Food: chicken waffles - flavor is decent, but was dry BLT sandwich - Looked and tasted as if a 10-year old child made it Soup - Can't remember what type, but do remember it was lukewarm Steak fries - Had to chase down the waitress to get it. 5 (literally) bandage-size fries came out on a small worn-out side plate...  Bill - Waitress told us fries was included as a side, but then charged us $5. Had to ask her to remove it. 5 for 5 bandage-sized fries???

I love this restaurant. My friend and I went for brunch and to share giggles and it was the perfect place. She ordered the red velvet waffles and I ordered a turkey salad. When items arrived my mouth watered just a little due to the great presentation of the food. The salad was just not any ordinary salad the warm bacon crumbs mixed in with their homemade dressing and bread crumbs was so yummy.The staff was also very nice.

Visiting NC and friends recommended Terrace for breakfast. Very family friendly. I ordered the fried green tomatoes and southern sausage eggs Benedict. Husband had shrimp and grits. Both of us really enjoyed our meal. The fried green tomatoes were out of this world delicious. This will be our main spot whenever we visit.
It's been a few months since I went were,  but my mouth is still watering for the lemon poppyseed French toast.  I will be back.

I've been to Terrace Cafe for lunch a few times, but recently tried it for dinner.  I was a little disappointed they weren't serving the red velvet waffles at dinner time, but I went ahead and ordered from the dinner menu.  The chicken was delicious!!  I was not disappointed!  My husband said his mussels were excellent also.

The customer service by our waiter and the manager was completely inept. You would expect a complete apology and regret from the manager when you informed them that our kids ate MOLD from the fruit. Same type of mold you see in strawberries left in your fridge.   No type of communication or sincere apology. We were asked "WHY" when we cancelled our order. Well...what do you expect.   We aren't the type to complain as my wife and I have been servers in the past. But, we do know how this should have been handled.  Edit...similar review by Mai T in March. So please issue your standard apology reply here.

Went on a Friday morning and we were sat upstairs.  It took forever to get someone for our water, to take our order, for the food to be served, and even for the check.  The breakfast here was nothing to write home about.  Had their egg benedict, but they put whole grain mustard in their hollandaise sauce - which gives it a very sour taste instead of the slight hint of lemon juice - and it's just wrong.  Overpriced for the subpar service and mediocre food.  Will not be back.
The location of the place is really nice.  The staff pleasant and the food even better.  Definitely worth the effort!

Like a previous reviewer, I was underwhelmed with the Full Breakfast that I ordered during my first visit to Terrace Cafe last week for lunch.  It wasn't bad, but for half the price I had the same thing at The Original Pancake House  this morning and enjoyed it just as much or possibly more.  Granted, I could have ordered something with a little bit more imagination, but if a restaurant can't handle simple things then I have to wonder whether or not it can handle more complex items.    The hummus appetizer we ordered arrived with sesame seed covered pita for dipping.  Unfortunately, I can't say much for the hummus because it was completely overwhelmed by the flavor of the sesame seeds on the pita.  I'm not a fan of sesame seeds, so I took one bite and left it at that.  My companion ordered the tomato and mozzarella salad and really enjoyed it.  He also enjoyed the hummus more than I, but he likes sesame seeds so....  Thanks to a $30 gift certificate from Groupon, our lunch tab was only $18.00.  (I paid $12 for GC and left $6 tip.)  Without the GC, our tab would have been almost twice as much.  I'll try Terrace Cafe again because I have another gift certificate.  Hopefully next time I'll be as pleased with my meal as some of the other reviewers.

Well, where to begin... so we ate there at around 9 on a weekday, Rather slow time of the day, yet you couldn't tell from server presence. Real nice guy that served us. He started out super nice and approachable, then he just vanished after opening spiel. This is when it's crumbled, bad food plus lack of care on staffs part. Shrimp m grits, shrimp grotesquely undercooked, and it was possible either microwaved or boiled. . Nastee!!! Then my friends hash browns we're burned on outside yet chilled in center. This is when you know that nobody is concerned is when all the shrimp are still on plate yet grits r eaten. One would think to ask if there was something wrong with the dish, being main component was not ate. SERVER SIMPLY HURRIED ALONG AND DROPPED CHECK, NOT ONCE ASKING HOW OUR MEAL WAS. POOR FORM. LACKLUSTER STAFF WILL/AND DOES BRING THE RESTAURANT DOWN. A CHARISMATIC  SERVER WOULD OF HANDLED THIS WITH CARE AND WOULD MAKE ME NOT CONCERNED WITH THE FOOD PROBLEM, NOT HEIGHTEN CURRENT SITUATION.

Terrace Café red velvet waffle was delicious!! The scrambled eggs were good and the fruit was fresh. I also had dinner at Terrace Cafe before but the red velvet waffle was the highlight of my food experience.

The service here is awful. Walked in and asked for a table for 5... the hostess didn't take my name and said to hold on 'right there' for a few minutes. I literally stood about 5 steps in front of the stand. After about 15 minutes I went up to her and she stated, "oh I thought we seated you." Then she took my name. We waited for about 15 more minutes and in that time one of the members of our party began feeling sick. He went to lay down in the car when they called our name. We stated that we had four people now - and they said they could no longer seat us because they had a 6-top... and we would require a 4-top. We did not want to be moved to the back of the list AGAIN, so we went to get our friend from the car. After about two minutes, our friend returned and when they brought us up to our table... we were at a four seater with an additional chair jammed into the corner.  This is after them telling us they could not seat us w/ only four people because they reserved a larger table. We saw the larger table open and asked the hostess if we could move there and she said, 'she's just doing what they told her' and when someone in our party suggested we should leave after all this she said, 'that's fine' and walked away without saying anything further. We were left standing in the middle of the restaurant. We looked over the banister and saw they had moved on, seating other parties. It should also be noted that there were MANY MANY open tables. As we walked out, the manager saw us leaving and didn't say a word. A member of our party had to ask if he was the manager. As she told the manager what happened and he did not say sorry ONCE. I have been here before... and the food is good... but it is not worth the headache. The hostesses clearly do not give a sh*t and have no idea what they're doing, and the manager doesn't seem that concerned either.  We went to McDonald's across the street instead and received better customer service there. Seriously.

Had brunch at the Terrace Cafe on a recent weekend morning. It is a bit ironic that a place called the Terrace Cafe doesn't have any outdoor seating, but my understanding is that the other location does? We waited about 20 minutes for a table and were seated upstairs. Our waitress was very friendly and personable (Julie, I think.) I had the salted caramel latte, which was delicious, as well as the biscuit and gravy with fruit salad. They make the sausage in house, and it was very good. The dish comes with one large biscuit, smothered in their cream sausage gravy. I was a happy camper. My one complaint was that the fruit salad was a little bit warm - I would have preferred it cold and fresh out of the fridge. I'm sure we'll return for brunch, but I'd also like to try some of their lunch and dinner offerings -

This was my first time visiting Terrace Cafe but it won't be my last. Everything was pleasant. The inside is a nice little cafe atmosphere with two levels to it. From the time we walked it we were greeted with friendly smiles. Our wait was only 30 mins so that wasn't bad. I had the Red Velvet. Waffles with Fried Chicken. Everything was deliscious. The chicken wasn't over cooked and had a great flavor to it. The Grits were just how I like them, nice and creamy. The Mimosa was even great. I look forward to coming back and trying the Crab Cakes Eggs Benedict.
Food was great the red velvet waffle was awesome!!!! If you visit the Queen City you should try it out

Drinks were delicious, food didn't live up to the hype.  Shrimp and grits were the worst I've ever had and the fried green tomatoes were descent.  Greeters were awesome but waiter kept disappearing and not checking in on the group... All in all I would recommend this restaurant.

Red Velvet Waffle with Cream Cheese drizzle was perfect. I was worried it would be overwhelmingly sweet but it wasn't at all. It was surprisingly light, yet flavorful and I wanted more. I also got the chicken to make this more like a chicken and waffles but I wasn't a fan of the chicken. It was a piece of fried chicken breast. This wasn't a deal breaker for me. My hubs had the shrimp and grits and they were good. We will return here and it is a good place to try out.
Boring menu average food
The food here is nothing short of amazing I love the shrimp and grits the red velvet waffle and  drinks. Always great service and great food I have been many times
My girlfriend and I's favorite breakfast spot. Pretty much can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

I don't usually write reviews, or ever give 5 stars, but I had one of the BEST breakfasts I have ever had at Terrace Cafe. I'm a big fan of red velvet cake, so when I saw they had a red velvet waffle, I had to try it. In a word: AMAZING. Not too sweet, light fluffy batter, cream cheese "syrup".... Like nothing I've ever had before. I ordered it with fried chicken, which was a boneless, generously sized crispy piece of all white meat, served on the side. I put it on the waffle for a pure decadent taste experience. Yum, yum, yum!  And as a side note, my order came with hash browns, which were some of the best I've ever had. Obviously they were fresh, shredded by hand with just the right amount of onion mixed in for flavor, and fried to a crispy golden finish on top. My boyfriend is kind of a picky eater, and he could not stop raving about how great the hash browns were.  Excellent service, full bar (I had a mimosa), and a nice comfortable atmosphere (we ate outside) all make this place a "must visit" whenever I'm in Charlotte.

I've had all great experiences trying new restaurants in Charlotte until this one.  The best way to describe my experience would be like when you get overcharged for a buffet at a fancy hotel. I ordered the "chef's special hash" for $15, which was very plain, simple, and small. Eggs, hash browns, and a few peppers.  I looked at my plate and told my wife, "this is something we could have easily made at home"

Why haven't I been here before? Cute place with a great atmosphere. Their menu has a great variety.  I had their Hawaiian Chicken Salad Croissant Sandwich. Yum! I had their vinegar based coleslaw, which I loved. It's how my mom makes her coleslaw...but mayo slaw lovers my not be a fan.  The price is pretty decent. I'd rather go here for a couple extra bucks and quality than the Panera across the street.  I hear their breakfast is awesome too. Red Velvet Pancakes?? Awesome!

Phenomenal breakfast. The Terrace Cafe is a must go there culinary gem. Wonderful, satisfying, and unique breakfast fare. A red velvet waffle topped with a light cream cheese drizzle was placed in front of me with a perfectly cooked piece of boneless fried chicken. The waffle was magical; not too heavy and not over-the-top sweet. It was decadent. The chicken came out piping hot and was cooked perfectly; moist and encapsulated in a light and crunchy breading; the kind of breading that inspires you to pick the remnants up off the plate with the pads of your fingers. The chicken was so delicious, I ordered a fried chicken eggs benedict. The same amazing chicken with two perfectly poached eggs; not to runny, not too hard. And the hollandaise sauce was rich and light all at once and didn't over-power the eggs.  The staff here is amazing. They have incredible coffee that was served to us by a coffee genius named Ben. The heart atop my cappuccino stayed until I finished it.  Our waiter Chris was fantastic and friendly and very patient with my food indecisiveness. Patrick the chef as incredible. It's obvious the staff here care about their product and their service. I can't say enough about the wonderful experience my husband and I had here. Counter area seating is first come first serve but if you do encounter a line, you must wait. It will be worth it.  There are not enough stars to give. We will definitely return.

I have to say I was not a fan of the service, but it was a Sunday brunch and quite packed so I'll definitely return for another try.   I went with a friend, he ordered an omelet, I had a quiche. The food was wonderfully executed, the portions we perfect and the atmosphere was excellent.   We were excited to try a dessert, but in the haste of a full section we asked for dessert menus and the waitress had already prepared the check. Que sera, sera, I walked out in a great mood with a full stomach.   I can't wait to go back at a less busy time to see what the atmosphere would be like in a different setting!
Best breakfast we've had in Charlotte! The service was amazing!  The food was great! Kaitlin our server was awesome! Definitely coming back to eat again! Nothing like this from where we're from.
Delicious! Attentive wait staff. Food came out really quickly. I really enjoyed the upper level seating.

Dont believe the hype with this place  Red Velvet Waffle with chicken!!! The cream cheese drizzle on top of the waffle  was decent. Chicken was two small tenders and not enough meat to be satisfied. I couldn't eat the hash browns, it smell weird and were under cooked. The waffle was tasteless and a bust.  The food  was a big disappointment and definitely not worth paying $18.00! It looked much better than it tasted.   Dont waste your time coming here. It is located in a nice area, but the cafe is very small with limited seating and looks outdated for the area.   Go somewhere else if your craving chicken and waffles. There was another location in Charlotte that sells it for $5.00-$7.00 with great reviews. If you choose to go here and feel disappointed after. You can only blame yourself, you was warned

Personally, I did not enjoy my salad. Went out to dinner with a group of friends for my sister's birthday... Our waiter forgot to put in the order for my boyfriends food. So he sat while everyone ate. By the time we got it everyone was done eating. We took his food to go instead. The waiter didn't even give us a reasoning and wasn't willing to accommodate us for the inconvenience, and to top it off, gave us an attitude when we asked to speak to the manager.  A basic plain caesar salad was $6. I had iceberg lettuce, croutons, and added chicken.... $15. $11 for a piece of chicken?? All in all, never ever ever going back there. Wouldn't recommend it to anyone. Over priced. The atmosphere sucks. Loud. Cramped. Portions of food are small... Leave you feeling hungry still. Would rather just go to Chili's.

Omg I love this place! The hubby and I have been twice for brunch and both times were amazing. Yes the wait is long but it's worth it. The mimosas and bellinis are on point and the fried green tomatoes are perfect. My absolute favorite is the red waffle and chicken. It's not too sweat and the flavors come together nicely.

We have never had a bad experience here! Everything is always delicious. This time we tried the fried green tomatoes... Sooooo tasty! Hot and crispy with spicy dipping sauce! Service was excellent. Definitely our favorite brunch spot!

One of my favorite brunch places in Charlotte! Right down the road from my home, this places never disappoints. The service is always top-notch and the staff is extremely friendly.   I always get the Red Velvet Waffle with extra cream cheese drizzle (no shame) with a side of cheese grits. HEAVEN! I go to school in New England and I'm always overjoyed when I get to come home and head to the Terrace Cafe.

Peeking out from the corner behind Taco Mac in Piedmont Row is Terrace Café. With a menu boasting S'mores French Toast and Red Velvet Waffles, there is often a wait list of people seeking an indulgent breakfast on weekends.  If there is no time to lose waiting for the hungry masses who beat you there, visit on a weekday, when there generally is not a wait.  Don't want dessert for breakfast? No matter, there is something for every taste and moderation level. Terrace Café even has a few dishes decorated with the seal of approval from the Harris Y Express and YMCA nutritionist. There is an obvious partnership there, as post-Y workout customers clad in sweats join groups of SouthPark soccer moms dining among local celebrities at Terrace. No, not Ric Flair (WOOO!) this time, but jack-of-all media, Jon Wilson (WILSON!)  According to the clearly over sat server, the Red Velvet Waffle is their breakfast bestseller. It is surprisingly airy and moist, and the well-portioned cream cheese drizzle is just the right amount of sweet to keep that nagging "sugar belly" sensation at bay.  Eggs Benedict and cheese grits that rival those at The Flying Biscuit are stars of the savory menu choices, and dishes are presented beautifully on geometrically angled platters. Seasonal fruit tops off the gluttony, and beverages are served in curved glasses that look like they'll tip, but due to the magic of physics, do not.  Your full belly may make you tip, though, after sampling the fine foods at Terrace Café.

Atmosphere good Service excellent Timeliness average Accomodating Food average- bisquits and gravy ok but we've had better.  Trademark breakfast casserole was good, not great - a little dry and overcooked.   Trendy. Value for price was ok.  Bacon was awesome - nice & crispy.  Steak was average - little guy added ketsup.  Service staff awesome Atmosphere awesome Food good.  We'll be back!
Good experience for dinner date. Definitely was pretty empty/quiet. Go for brunch if you want it to feel like a "terrace cafe". Food's always good. Server accommodated paleo request to boot!

This will be one of my staple brunch spots when I'm in Charlotte!! When we first walked in there was no wait on a saturday afternoon around 2pm and parking in the garage was free. First off let me say this restaurant provided AMAZING 5 STAR service. I went to brunch with my sister and cousin and our waitor so so kind, attentive, and quick! I ordered the popular red velvet waffle with chicken and cheesy grits! The chicken was really good and seasoned I pretty much forgot about the waffle lol it was about $17.50 for my food alone kinda pricey. I liked the chicken I don't think I'll get the waffle again. But all of our food was good!
Love the ambience, vibe, and the food. Enough said.
Coffee fantastic. The guys at the bar, Chris and Ian, are always cheerful and attentive. Breakfast is a must, my Mom just adores the strawberry waffles.

Their is nothing more that I can say about this place except GO there and try it. We were driving thru the Charlotte area and found this place. What a gem...I got the Red Velvet Waffle and it was simply divine. I also tried my sis's shrimp and grits and my niece's omelet was outstanding. I can't wait till I am back in NC again so I can eat here again.

The best chicken and waffles I have ever had! The wait on a Saturday morning around 11am was only about 20 minutes. My friend and I ordered the mimosa special for $8 and it was delicious! I decided on the chicken and red velvet waffles. Making it red velvet was an added cost, but absolutely worth it! The chicken was boneless and tender, while the heavenly waffles also came with a cream cheese icing sauce. I can't wait to go back for brunch soon!

Finally found a good breakfast place in Charlotte!  Came here for my birthday brunch a few weeks ago and all I have to say is that the Red Velved Waffle was pretty amazing! My boyfriend had an egg white omelet, which was pretty tasty and the French Press coffee was yummy too!  I cannot wait to come back and try the French Toast!

Oh what good Breakfast food!  Great stop after the Saturday morning Farmer's market.  Or stop before the mall opens.  Did both this morning.  Breakfast casserole is my go to.  Unbelievable pancakes...dare you to finish the plate!  Great grits, omelets or just standard breakfast plate.  Wonderful wait staff too

This is a fantastic place for brunch.  Ask what the homemade jam is that day and if it sounds like something you like, be sure to get toast!  Hashbrowns are phenomenal as well as the banana split parfait.  Caramel coffee cake is dangerously addictive.

Underwhelmed... We were hungry for breakfast and it got the job done but didn't deliver beyond that. Our server has a bit of a 'tude. But hey, we're fed and caffeinated. The coffe cake was really good if you have a sweet tooth.

I always get to Terrace when my family is visiting from Australia and it never disappoints. Now don't get me wrong I am just as happy being at waffle house when it comes to a hangover cure so I'm not a brunch snob but this is a great place to have a meal.  Only giving it 4 stars because the staff can be a little grumpy and I have had a few grumpy hostesses when I took my baby and stroller in. Otherwise the food is exceptional and the bloody Mary El Diablo is the best thing to happen to the bloody mary.

I visited this restaurant for breakfast and was I in for a surprise. If you are looking for some unique breakfast selections and a very nice atmosphere, check it out. It's a great addition to the South Park area.   I had a fine experience with our waiter, food was served quickly and as ordered. I tried the chocolate smore french toast. This plate is huge! Way more than a normal person could/should eat in one sitting. But, maybe a good idea to share. Or perhaps they offer a half size if you request it? I think I will try that next time. It is absolutely delicious by the way, especially if you are a french toast addict like myself. I am always going to restaurants and trying whatever unique french toast offering they have come up with. This one certainly did not disappoint. I also tried some of my husbands grits, and they were to die for.
The food was amazing! The atmosphere was warm and the service was great! I will most definitely go back!

The food is amazing! I had the red velvet waffle, fired chicken and fruit. I loved the cream cheese icing on the waffle. I didn't care for the fruit. On the down side, our waiter Seth was very dry and gave is a vibe he didn't want to be there. Poor service that day but greatttt food!

I went here for Sunday brunch last weekend with some friends. I've been to Charlotte many times before but never tried this place before but read good reviews about it! There's a parking deck right beside the restaurant which was very convenient. It was a 45 minute wait but the area the restaurant is in was very nice and it was a nice day outside so we decided to just walk around while we waited. After about forty minutes we got a call that our table was ready. The inside was very nice and quaint. There is an upstairs area that allows for more seating. I ended up getting the red velvet waffle with chicken and a side of fruit. Also I was stuck between getting the dueling mimosa and the regular mimosa. I asked the waitress and she told me the dueling mimosa really wasn't that great and recommended the sunshine mimosa so I ended up ordering that and it was great! Also my food was absolutely delectable!!! The chicken was boneless and very tender and well seasoned. The waffle was soft, light, and fluffy and the fruit was ripe and not too ripe! All in all, this place is a great brunch spot with delicious food!

Tried it for family brunch while in town for a wedding, there was 35 min wait for tables but our group was 6 sat down in bar area right away. Ordered the famous red velvet waffles with fried chicken - waffle was soft but flavor was good (sweet) but the fried chicken batter was crispy, flavorful and delicious!

Subpar food...chicken and waffle, quiche...omelet and even simple eggs. Asked for over medium with sausage and fruit...they delivered runny eggs, bacon and no fruit.  The chicken and waffle was supposed to come with a side...I asked for grits and they never delivered.  We will not return.

This review is for dinner, two stars is generous. We were seated in a dark, small space upstairs even though it was empty. The service was slow and very immature. I had the crab bisque which tasted like water with flour, and the halibut which was massively overcooked, sandpaper dry and tasteless. Really bad, won't be back.
This place has great southern food with a modern twist. I absolutely would eat here again. Fair price points for all dishes. The smothered chicken is to die for!
Love the atmosphere of this place. Red Velvet Waffles are to die for. Today I had the Turkey Omelet, I absolutely loved it.

food was great!!service suck!!our server didnt even refill our water until it was time for us to go.he had to send the bus boy to do it.we notice the whole hour we was there he was just to busy flirting with this two young ladies .we felt totally ignored the whole time we was there.yea great food but not worth going back is service suck!!food took about 20min and the cafe only had about 3 tables on a friday night!
Gourmet breakfast, delicious and inexpensive. Excellent service in nice atmosphere and free parking.

Very nice place, lovely wait staff, great location. the place is pricey, but overall has good food and good atmosphere. its a tad chilly in there but rather be chilly than hot. our waitress was great, i asked to try a sauce before ordering the eggs benedict. which was good but not fantastic, the canadian bacon is good, i just was surprised how thick of slices they point on there. i could have used just one of them sliced in half, kinda overpowered the Benedict. cant wait to try something different next time, the shrimp and grits were amazing according to my mom. it comes with fried spears of okra on the top of the shrimp and grits. lovely place, will return.

After a long and treacherous New Year's Eve (picture being cut off at the bar below Gastro Lounge, and continuing to drink out of a Stella can tucked in my trenchcoat)-- well, yea. We needed breakfast recovery. So to Terrace Cafe we went.  The notorious "wait" ensued. We weren't the only hungover ones, and as the rain drizzled, we recanted the night before, before being seated 30 mins later.  We spotted about 6 open tables as we're led in, we wondered why we weren't seated earlier.  Ordered foamy cappuccinos, and fresh squeezed OJ. Started feeling the road to recovery.  The menu looked great. We wanted to order everything. But I stuck to something I've missed, poached eggs. We ordered:      Eggs Florentine.     Full breakfast, and     the Cajun Shrimp Omelet.  My eggs were perfectly poached, which made me happy. The Hollandaise sauce actually tasted like Hollandaise sauce. My English muffin however was a tad over fried and hard. Oh well. Overall tasty. Good salad. Good hash.  My friends dug their meals. The Cajun Shrimp was a bit too pungent of a thing to eat hungover (eggs and fishyness...) but seemed OK. Bit over the top onion-y.  Finished. Service was just OK.  Bit pricey, but the best hangover cure. Will come here again.  Rankings      # of times dined here: 1st     Cost of Bill: $12-18 for 1person     Food Rating: 8/10     Service Rating: 7/10

As soon as I walked in I was awed by the amount of people on both levels. This is always a good sign. We were seated quickly (party of two). The waiter was very swift initially and quite friendly. I ordered the (house made) sausage egg and cheese buttermilk biscuit which came with a choice of hash browns, grits or fruit. I went with the hash browns. My cousin ordered the red velvet waffle with chicken - I should've ordered that! The biscuit itself was just ok and so was everything on and around it. I was thinking house-made sausage had to be something spectacular like Neese's... not so much. To be honest, Bojangles has a better patty. Of course I had to taste the chicken and waffles and the chicken was so tender and moist and the waffle was just sweet enough to not need any syrup but not so sweet that it caused a diabetic coma. As we were waiting for our food, I noticed the hostess walking with a half-empty plate of food ( I guess she was headed to the kitchen??) and she grabbed something from the plate and ate it! That threw me for a loop considering the ambiance given off by the restaurant. Other than that, I was pleased by the wait staff. One waiter who was not serving us even offered to check to see if our car was still on the street - apparently there are certain hours for parking on the street without being towed. Overall, I had a good experience and I will give it another try. I just know to avoid the basics and go for something more extravagant if I want some flavor.
This is one of my favorite breakfast/lunch places in Charlotte! The chicken and waffles is like Heaven in your mouth.

Delicious! OMG, the red velvet waffle was mind blowingly good! Everything is a la carte so I ordered a side of the inhouse made sausage... shut the front door! It was an explosion of flavor! I will be a regular here for sure!

I cannot say enough good things about this place. First of all we drive 45 minutes just to eat here if that tells you anything. The food is amazing. They have a huge variety and the service is top notch. Super clean too. I think you can dine outside if you want but we never have. A must try for anyone who loves brunch and a vast gourmet menu!

We just paid a $50 breakfast for two and were seated in the employee break-room AKA upper level left side, outside the server station. During our meal, up to 8 employees congregated in that space to take a break, eat, stand around socializing and prep food.  At one point, the manager dropped in too.  One suggestion: The owners/management need to build a separate employee break-room or avoid seating patrons in that area and train employees appropriate server etiquette when patrons are in view. Customer service 101.
Warning:  Do NOT go here for breakfast.  Dinner is okay but breakfast is probably not a good idea.  I have to say that their mochas are tasty (when they are hot)

I hate writing negative commentary on local businesses, but I was really disappointed in how Terrace Cafe treated us at breakfast.    We are big groupon users, and I have NEVER had an institution think twice about fully honoring a *purchased* groupon just past its expiration date before now.  There is a first for everything I suppose ... this is just incredibly short-sighted.  The whole point of a groupon is to get someone to try something new, in hopes that they will become something of a recurring customer.  I regularly hold breakfast and lunch meetings in the South Charlotte restaurant scene, and thought Terrace Cafe might be a good place for such meetings.  But they have lost my business with this foolishness.  Incredibly frustrating.  The food itself was fine, though I think the hype has more to do with the nice ambience than particularly wonderful food.  I had the acclaimed red velvet waffle and found it ... okay.  Just okay.  It was dense (which makes sense for red velvet) and dry.  It certainly wasn't *bad,* but it just didn't come across as anything special among waffles.  Different?  Yes.  Delicious?  I wouldn;t go nearly that far.  My wife thought her eggs, biscuit and grits were done nicely.  And we both enjoyed our fru-fru coffees.  The presentation was attractive and the service was better than the somewhat mixed comments you read about this place, probably because we went on a Tuesday.  So overall it was good, but not the *amazing* we were hoping for.  (These are honest opinions on the food and experience, formed BEFORE the groupon nonsense occurred at the end of the meal.)  Honestly though ... if you're rating this place specifically on food is it meaningfully better than the nearby Original Pancake House?  Not based on what we tasted today.  Now the setting is in a difference league entirely ... but the food itself wasn't a special draw.  Given the OPH's standing as an excellent place for customer service and a good place to do business breakfasts, Terrace Cafe might be well served to think a little more broad-mindedly about how they treat their would-be customers.

I lived upstairs from Terrace Cafe in corporate housing for my first couple months in Charlotte. Since we were still settling down, we got take-out from Terrace Cafe a LOT. Here's how it went: Look for menu online.  Call in order.  Walk downstairs.  Get food.  NOSH.   Here are some of my faves:   -- NC Trout with tempura green beans (DROOL!  Fast food places should replace fries with tempura green beans!) in a pineapple soy burre blanc.  The trout is super flaky and fresh, and the burre blanc so sinfully rich, it could make a cardboard box taste good!  -- Pork Tenderloin with black eyed pea succotash and jalapeno jam.  Tender and well seasoned, and the succotash and jam give it a nice sweetness.   -- Vegetable Plate.  I know, sounds sissy, but it's delicious.  A potato side, a side of tempura green beans (see, there they are again!) baby carrots (with the little green stems attached, nice touch) and asparagus.  Trust me, you won't miss the meat.   -- Bibb Salad:  my favorite starter here.  Mandarin oranges, pears, Crasins and the kicker... fried goat cheese!  Add fried goat cheese to...oh yeah, that cardboard box, and again, a delicious dish.   -- Fried Green Tomatoes: served with pimento cheese.  "Nuff said.   The reason why I don't give TC 5 stars, is I had some just OK experiences for breakfast and lunch.  (Please, don't hurt me, Terrace Cafe diehards!) The famed red velvet waffle and banana pecan french toast were just too sweet.  I'm going to get a CAVITY sweet.   The lunch I ordered was a vegetable soup with olives...and the turkey sandwich was just that.  A boring turkey sandwich.  (Olives I think is one of those foods either you like or don't like, and it should be indicated on the menu or by the server if something has olives or not.)   The service is always friendly and pretty on-point.  The ambiance too is inviting and warm-- both levels.    Don't forget to check out their deals-- like buy-one-dinner-get-the-second 50% off certain days of the week!

The food is good but the service is horrible. I went in there once and the server was so unprofessional me and my friends didn't even see him other then when he took our order, the server serving at the table beside us had to go get us our drinks. Then when it was time for the tab the server charged me and my friend for the same tab, I called back twice to tell the manager what happened the first time he told me to wait second time I got out on hold then hung up on. If you are gonna eat here just get the food to go. Me and my friend both have bank account statements to prove that we were charged twice. The server that we wanted to tip didn't even get the tip that we left for him because the server messed up while charging the cards. I am a broke college student and now I am $67 short. That was going to go towards my water bill. Never again. The server should get fired, he started cussing right when he got to our table smh. HORRIBLE service.
Awesome place!! The fried green tomatoes with pimiento cheese is absolutely to die for! Also the omelet you make yourself is amazing with goat cheese!!
The best brunch in Charlotte!  The red velvet waffles, berry split, fried green tomatoes, were beyond outstanding! Worth the 40 monwait!
RED VELVET WAFFLES AND FRIED CHICKEN!!Wow wow wow wow wow! Simply amazing! Great food! Great atmosphere! I really enjoyed my meal! Thanks so much for the awesome service!!

Simply one of the best places to have a weekend brunch in Charlotte period. Rarely do you find this level of consistency in a food place without breaking the bank. Service is also great and their attention to your needs is . One thing to keep in mind, this place is popular so expect some wait, but I suggest you do, it's worth it.
Awesome spot for breakfast brunch. Try the Red Velvet Waffle!

The location was a little out there but it was our first time we went there and it was amazing food! We had the omlett with pancakes and both dishes were incredible! The service was also quick and friendly which made us definitely want to come back!

Shrimp n grits!!!! WOW was this food excellent......great service, and the Piedmont center is beautiful. Such a refreshing change from Chicago. This was walking distance from my hotel, the Renaissance. The coffee was excellent as well; I tasted a salted carmel latte. The cafe menu is extensive, and the food menu had a good variety.  I also tasted the filet medallions and eggs meal, the steak was cooked perfectly and was tender. My shrimp and grits was the highlight, however. I got the sauce on the side (I do not like very spicy food, and that BBQ sauce WAS spicy), and it was perfect. The chorizo and fried okra were delicious in it. Such an innovative dish.  Next time I am in Charlotte, I will return!
Great place for brunch! I had the Steak and eggs entree with hashbrowns.. Great food quality.. Definitely recommend this place to my friends.

Stopped by the Terrace while visiting Charlotte and really enjoyed it. I liked the ambience and feel of the restaurant. My honey had the shrimp and grits with a mule and I had the crab cake benedict with a cranberry mimosa. The wait wasn't too bad considering it was a Saturday afternoon. However, I will add the young hostess should be a bit more attentive as they check in and seat guest. Two couples that arrived after us were seated before us and the buzzer they provided didn't go off. All in all, I'd still return.

First of all their food is slightly better than adequate.  Called the day before spoke with the Manager who told us to come in with our party of 15 and they would make sure we sat together.  Showed up waited for all 15 people to make it, when they did not show we ask for a table for 10.  They split us into two booths.  The whole idea was a get together.  The managers response was "what do you want me to do", nuff said.  When a manager of a restaurant says that the other obvious problems become much worse.  The 4 hostesses never smiled welcomed us or said goodbye or thank you.  The waiter had a lon gotee that everyone was afraid would fall in our food.  He never smiled and never said thankyou.  If semi-good food with real bad service is what you want I recommend this restaurant.  The owner needs to hire workers that smile and thank the customer who pays their wages.

Had the famous red velvet waffles and chicken with fruit salad. It was delicious and the fruit was fresh. Absolutely no complaints.  Meant to review last time I went, this was actually my third time going and I will be back again for sure.

Great experience. I tried the red velvet waffles and fried chicken. The waffle isn't extremely street and the cream cheese sauce was a great compliment because it wasn't too sweet as well. the fried chicken is a thin breast and not a wing. The staff was very courteous and patience. I will definitely eat there again

Lunch Spot when in South Park!  I was eager to try the Terrace Cafe having gone to school with the guy who now owns it and Ive been promising to try it.  I took my grandmother to lunch there on a Thursday around 12pm and walked right in. The front door staff seemed a bit distant and robotic, but walked us to the table up the stairs. We sat overlooking the first level and were approached by our bright and friendly server, Vivian.  We looked over the VAST menu and teetered between lunch and breakfast. Both looked Great.  We chose lunch. Granny ordered the Hawaiian Chicken Salad-Salad and I ordered the Mighty Corned Beef. Both were of good size when they arrived. Granny's salad was a Large scoop of delicious, Pineapple-laden creamy chicken salad that was Super fresh and light, over top of crisp mesclun greens. I wasn't sure what the dressing was, but it was sent on the side (love that) and granny didn't even use it.  My Mighty Corned Beef was just that! A beautiful sandwich of HOT Corned Beef, Chef's Slaw, Russian dressing, on perfectly toasted Marble Rye. Served with Thick Cut Steak Fries, this was a MEAL to write about (that's why I'm doing it). Although we were full, the dessert tray (nothing beats a tray) was brought over. The dessert portion sizes were great, small enough to have a few bits if sharing, and large enough to not feel ripped off! We shared the Blondie and it came out HOT, with a perfect scoop of vanilla and flavorful.  Service was perfect, food came out fast, drinks stayed full, it was overall a wonderful time.

This is one of my family's favorite restaurants to eat brunch. The food and service is excellent here. The only downside is they don't take reservations and the wait is really long so make sure to get there early.

We tried this restaurant while on vacation in NC. I had the Shrimp & Grits and it was AMAZING!!!!!!!! It was spicy, but the creamy grits cooled off my mouth! I couldn't get enough of it!! I would recommend this place to anyone and the next time I am in Charlotte, I will be visiting this restaurant. It was fabulous!!!!!

We had dinner here last Saturday night. Couldn't decide what we wanted to eat and saw an add for them in Southpark magazine. Oh what the heck.. The place is rather unassuming from the outside. We arrived at around 6:30, and I would say around 40% full. The wait staff is very friendly. The first thing that grabbed my eye, was their wine list. The prices are very competitve! We had a nice bottle of pinot for $38! I saw an Italian wine on the menu that I paid $130 2 weeeks ago, and it was going for $75. On to the food,,, the menu was quite good and the thing that impresses is that all the food is organic and humane. Big plus! I had a chicken dish that was very tasty. My wife had a tender loin with a jalepeno sauce that was just right and not overpowering. I enjoyed our dining experience and would return definetely! A couple of things,,, lights are a little bright for dinner and they need some type of background music. The atmosphere was some what generic. They have a big breakfast and lunch crowd, so will be curious how they will compete in Piedmont Row(especially with George's opening up)

Went again yesterday and again it was excellent.  Still high quality, consistent, good service, everything you could ask.  I had the steak salad, wife had breakfast, daughter had banana pancakes, all great.  Consistency counts.
I've been here twice. Both times I had excellent lattes. I've also had both the red velvet and lemon poppyseed waffles. Both were phenomenal. Good service, too.

Had breakfast here with three other people.  I ordered the closest thing to regular Eggs Benedict (EB) I could find, and paired it with Earl Grey tea. The EB was miserable. EB is a classic dish for a reason. There is no benefit in trying to switch it up. The hollandaise was made with whole grain mustard, which destroyed the best part of the dish. The meat disks were about the diameter of a golf ball, and I don't even remember what the bread/English muffin was like.  Our server was a bit lukewarm, and, once things got super busy, the amount of time between visits to our table became way too long. Table mates sat without beverage refills for a while.   The space is pretty nice. It's bright and clean, but I could have certainly done without all the religious paraphernalia and signage at the host stand. If I wanted to deal with that, I'd go to a pancake breakfast at a local church. Couldn't wait to get out of there.
Went here for Saturday brunch with family. The food is pretty good. It was very packed but the service was friendly and fast.

My husband and myself with another couple came here this past Sunday for brunch. Very delicious and nice experience.  When we walked in, they had a 15 minute wait, which is not too bad for a Sunday brunch time. We were seated quickly and placed our order for drinks. The guys got French Press coffee. Only snafu of the day. Even after sitting for 5 minutes the french press coffee was the color of tea and had no coffee flavor. The waitress said there was new bar staff that day and they had been messing up drink orders all morning. Fortunately she switched it out for regular coffee for them.   My husband and I ordered an omelet with chorizo, salsa, and goat cheese with hashbrowns and a side order of biscuits and gravy. Our friends order the hash scramble of the day and a chicken and egg biscuit. The omelet was fantastic!! I also appreciated that they gave us some type of jam for the bread. It seemed and tasted homemade to me. The biscuits and gravy were definitely the winner though! Our friends even ordered one when they saw ours. Super delish!  Overall fantastic service and meal.

I am not much of a breakfast person, but this place was great.  It is a bit pricey for breakfast but worth it.  The red velvet waffle is to die for, and the grits were the best I have ever had.  Definitely looking forward to going back!

After landing in Charlotte, all I wanted were some good grits and brunch. Terrace Cafe was a wise, wise choice!  Kenzie K. and I were here on a Saturday morning, with a 45 minute wait. Clearly, everyone else in Charlotte loves brunch a much as we do. Luckily, there's a nice little waiting area outside and you can also order some coffee or drinks from the bar while you're waiting.   Now, I'm a bit of a traditionalist when it comes to benedicts, but the Sausage Eggs Benedict (eggs, sausage, and Hollandaise on a biscuit) with cheese grits was beyond tasty. We also got the Fried Oyster Salad (it's a salad so it's definitely healthy, right?) Overall, great food and I wish I was able to try more of the menu when I was here!

I think this is the best brunch place in Charlotte. They offer a wide variety of menu items and everything I have tried is outstanding. My favorites are the biscuits and gravy, red velvet waffle, egg casserole, and usually any hash special they have. The Bavarian cream stuffed French toast is all out of this world, though it is extremely rich. The red velvet waffle is very unique and delicious. It is perfect even for those who don't like super sweet, the cream cheese frosting drizzle adds enough sweetness to not need syrup but doesn't over do it. Really you can't go wrong with anything here. Drinks are great too! Service can be slow on occasion and there is always a wait, but in my opinion the food is worth the wait!

Easy walking distance from the Renaissance Southpark hotel. Healthy beakfast selections look tasty as well.  The food was good, even superb but $42 (before the tip) for breakfast?  WTF?  Was here with the GF on a quick trip to Charlotte.  Granted, this is in the South Park area which is quite trendy and upscale but still, 42 bucks for omelettes, juice, coffee and pancakes...helllllllll no.  Won't be coming back here unless it's on the company dime.

Came here on a Sunday for breakfast. We were seated immediately when we walked in at around 9 am, but it was definitely much busier when we left at around 10 am. Their benedict was okay. Poached eggs were slightly overcooked. Side of grits was very bland. The kid's pancakes were in the shape of animals, which is cute but they were also small. My favorite thing that I ordered was their white mocha. I could drink that every morning.
I hate going out for breakfast because I don't eat eggs, but this restaurant has changed that!  Lemon Poppyseed Waffles... so good!
RUDE, RUDE AND RUDE!!!!  Seamed it was an inconvenience for them to even seat our party.
I have been here several times for Sunday brunch. The menu has a lot of options. Shrimp and grits is too good. Their red velvet waffle is excellent!! Orange juice is really fresh squeezed OJ!

Terrace is great! I work very close and love to walk over for coffee or a bacon, egg and cheese sandwich some mornings. Its always very fast and the service is great. I have also been to numerous lunches there and have never had a bad meal. Highly reccommend if you are in the Southpark area for breakfast, lunch or dinner.
Average breakfast fare...had pancakes, eggs, hash browns, and ham. Nothing special...

This edition of "Excited about Eating" takes us to the Terrace Café located in the Piedmont Town Center in the heart of SouthPark. This multi-use Town Center features shops, restaurants, offices, and residential properties arranged in a walkable community.  We arrived at 12:10 on a Saturday to a 75 minute wait. Honestly, we debated leaving but decided to wait and that was a great decision because it turned into a manageable 40 minutes. We had a great view of the industrial style loft area and the charm that comes with this type of structure.   Terrace Café offers a wide variety of options for breakfast, lunch and dinner. While waiting, we noticed that most of the dishes coming out of the kitchen were breakfast. Although they looked appetizing, we opted for lunch.  We started with an appetizer of Fried Green Tomatoes served with a warm pimento cheese dip.   The Fried Green Tomatoes arrived quickly and were crispy outside and tender inside with a slight vinegary taste. They were great. Even my wife, who really doesn't like tomatoes, enjoyed them. I think they could serve the cheese dip on anything and it would be great.  I ordered the Nashville Fried Chicken tossed in hot sauce and served over braised collard greens and mashed potatoes.  The chicken was outstanding, crispy and tender, but the mashed potatoes took the prize as the best component of this dish. They were light and creamy with just enough lumps to let you know they were freshly made. The collard greens were a combination of sweet and vinegary, and tasted great. The portions were huge, and definitely not for someone who doesn't like heat as the Nashville hot sauce lived up to its name. Dora here. Definitely a "forehead slicker." lol.  My wife ordered the Chicken Salad Croissant, a Hawaiian version of chicken salad on a fresh croissant served with lettuce and tomato and sweet potato waffle fries.   The chicken salad, made with cream cheese instead of the normal mayo, included grapes, pineapple, pecans, and mandarin oranges. The sweet potatoes waffle fries were a first for us, but something we'd definitely order again.  I finished off my meal with a Peanut Butter Cup Latte and my wife chose the Tiramisu Latte. Both were excellent and a great way to cap off our meal. Dora here. Lip-smacking yummy!  Overall I would highly recommend this restaurant for someone looking for a unique restaurant offering exceptional food. I would rate this establishment 5 forks out of 5 for a family friendly restaurant serving outstanding food. The restaurant was reviewed by Food Blogger Ernie Hiers. For other reviews see dorahiers.blogspot.com

Food was good and atmosphere was good.  And apparently Friday night was $5 glass of wine night!   I am already predisposed to love any place with breakfast all day anyway but the menu was a good mix of other options as well.  I had the red velvet waffles with chicken. Yeah pretty awesome. My wife had the strange-sounding but delicious crab cake BLT.  We will definitely go back!

I highly recommend this place to everyone! They close their breakfast and brunch at 2:30 (which is a bummer) and reopen later for dinner. I love everything on their menu but some of my all time favorites is shimp & gritz, fillet Benedict, salmon Asian salad, crab cake blt and the red velvet waffle. Their servers are just the sweetest!

Last weekend me and a few friends went here for brunch, visiting out of town. The atmosphere was amazing I didn't feel like unwanted there, the managers really helped out the servers there as well. Very nice place for brunch and it isn't expensive .. I will be back

I have now been here for breakfast, lunch and dinner, and all 3 were amazing.  At breakfast, my party all tried a bit of everything...one dish was better than the next.  The pancakes were the best I have had in any restaurant in years and the quiche is beyond description.  No doubt why this place was voted best breakfast in Charlotte. At lunch, my dad had salmon with steamed veggies, which was a genorous  and very tasty lunch portion, and I had the hummus appetizer and grilled cheese.  If you enjoy hummus, this one is not to be missed.  Portion size was LARGE and hummus was delightful.  At dinner, we ordered from the Valentines price fixe menu; we each had crab bisque, filet mignon, lobster and dessert; all were exceptional.  Breakfast, lunch or dinner, you will not be disappointed....TRY TERRACE CAFE!!!!!!!!!!!

Yikes. Strike 1: After waiting for 45 minutes we asked the hostess where we were in line and she told us we were next, yet we were not called next and got completely skipped over for an incomplete party when there is clearly a sign at the front that says they don't sit incomplete parties! Strike 2: they didn't have silverware, coke, sweet tea, clean dishes, nor did they have clean glasses. Strike 3: the food was completely flavorless. Not quite sure why people eat here. Our server was overwhelmed with other tables and barely even spoke to us. I think the only thing I enjoyed was my glass of water and my walk out of the door!  Update in response to the owner: A busy restaurant explains the lack of supplies but being skipped over in line is complete incompetence by the hostess and the other staff members up front. And the other party was still taken to their table despite us calling the hostess out on her error prior to them being seated.

I was so excited to try their red velvet waffle because waffle is one of my absolute favorite food. What a disappointment. It just tasted so plain and normal to me. I don't think it tasted any different than any other place. We may try it again sometime but we were definitely not impressed the first time.
Great place for breakfast, waiter was on point. Clean restaurant, with nice decor. Very friendly atmosphere...

The food was just meh. The "atmosphere" relatively non-existent. It does appear to be a very family friendly place, so I guess that's a plus. I ordered the veggie omelette, added cheese, subbed grits & a biscuit. The dish was intended to be healthy, but I did my best to change that. Unfortunately the food was just incredibly bland. It was disappointing, especially because of the cost. If you're going on a weekend, get there early, it gets packed. I don't think I'll be back though.

I went here specifically for the red velvet waffle. Sad to say I wasn't impressed. It was just red. No coco flavor or anything that resembled red velvet cake. It was a well prepard waffle although. I would go back to try other things on the menu.

Other than some over salted spinach, both our meals (Dijon chicken & chicken and waffles) were awesome. The whole menu looks fantastic and I can't wait to try other menu items. Service was impeccable, and the ambiance was very nice. It's too bad there is no outdoor seating it would perfect on a beautiful day.

So, I feel bad submitting this review but I'm doing it anyway. I'm in Charlotte often and Terrace used to be my go-to breakfast spot. Two previous visits I went to the Ballantine location and was so disappointed. Went to the Piedmont location this time and was disappointed as well.  3 strikes: your out! Table not cleaned well, server was less than welcoming, had to ask for silverware after food was served. Quality of food has declined sharply. Same tempting recipes in a nice atmosphere but my food was so heavy on the cooking grease (Chef's daily special Hash) that's really all I tasted, daughters poppyseed French toast was burnt on one side, sons eggs were cold; asked for over easy on 2 eggs, 1 yoke was broken and cooked hard and other yoke was in tacked but pretty much hard too. Regular coffee was barely warm, and cup came with lipstick stain from previous user. Second cup of coffee I ordered, decaf this time, was same low temp. The bill was a steep $125.00 for 6 of us and honestly IHOP would of (& has) done a better job for much less  $$.  I won't be back.

This place has really good food, but not enough selection in my opinion. I came for brunch and was expecting to be wow'd however the waitstaff was a few fries short of a happy meal, if you know what I mean. Go for the food but disregard the service. I recommend it but would not come frequently.

Great place for brunch! We went for my birthday and the waiter was awesome and attentive. Both locations have consistently good food. Only thing I would recommend is a little more seasoning on the grits. Everything else was flavorful!!

So sad. This location is excellent. The food is above average. The decor is lovely. The service...ugh. Why? Why? Why? It's so easy to fix?!? SMILE a little!! Even my teen-age sons said that our server didn't look like he enjoyed his job very much. Couldn't get refills on coffee to save my life. I admit, it was brunch...so coffee is a crazy request! He really missed out too. I'm a 50% tipper if the service is at least fair - as I understand everyone has a bad day. But NOBODY was smiling. Everyone looked miserable. And if your servers are miserable, that means your management is miserable. And if your management is miserable, than I certainly don't want to add to the funds of an owner that makes people miserable. Will give it another go, as I try to give everyone a 2nd chance, have even experienced a couple of turn-arounds...but man - it could be such a warm, successful, happy place...{sigh}

I'm very confused how this restaurant has positive reviews. We just finished our third (and hopefully last) time eating here, and every experience has been disappointing.  From mediocre service to poor quality food, this restaurant is a miss.

I love brunch! But I don't go often because I hate the wait. Fortunately, I was hanging with friends one weekend in Charlotte, so I feeling particularly patience. My patience paid off, because the food here is awesome. First, I'll comment on the atmosphere. The Terrace Cafe is decorated to look Italian, which threw me off a little because then I was expecting Mediterranean food, but I felt warm and comfortable here. They could have a little more seating for those of us waiting, but the wait wasn't really that bad. When we did sit down, we ordered mimosas, and they came pretty quickly. I got the waffle with strawberries on the top and I was oh so happy. My friend ordered a shrimp omelette, and I was jealous because it was so good. Next time I come, I'm getting that omelette! With a waffle on the side.

Has Potential  The Terrace Cafe in South Park has a good foundation going but could use a little polish. The inside is decorated tastefully and the restaurant itself was clean. The waitstaff was very nice but it was slow considering the fact that it was a Thursday and the restaurant was somewhat empty. I ordered the Bavarian Stuffed French Toast Sticks, while the flavors and spices were delicious and it was cooked very well, there was very little cream inside the toast itself and only stuffed on one side. One out of the three sticks didn't have any cream in them at ALL. Second, I also tried the house made sausage which flavor-wise was amazing! But they were extremely over cooked and very very dry. My friend ordered the Red Velvet Waffles which I had a bite of, they were very good and well cooked so no real problem on that end. Has potential but could use a bit of polish around the corners.
One of my favorite places! How can you dislike a place that has bacon bloody Mary's and red velvet waffles? Everyone is so friendly and outgoing. I wish I had the time to eat here every week!

my husband and I came here on a saturday at about 12:45 and it was packed! we waited for about 45 minutes and were then seated. We started with the fried green tomatoes but when they arrived we had no silverware, then when we got silverware the fork was dirty. the tomatoes were okay. hubby loved them though. We got the eggs benedict, hash browns, cheese grits, and red velvet waffle. I wasn't a fan of any of the savory items and I usually like eggs benedict. Again, my husband loved it though. The red velvet waffle was the only thing that wasn't just below 'okay', it was delicious! If you like red velvet it's a must have. and it surprisingly wasn't as heavy as i expected it to be, it was perfect. I'll be back just for that and to give the other menu items a try

We arrived at Terrace Cafe on Sunday around 1pm, that might be where we went wrong.  My expectations were high after reading all the reviews online, but we did not seem to have a great food experience.  The BEC (Bacon, Egg and Cheese Biscuit) I ordered was decent at best - the biscuit was rock hard.  I took the top off and ate the bacon, egg and cheese open faced, luckily they were all good.    We also ordered the California French Toast (orange flavored french toast).  The only orange flavor was the mandarin oranges in my fruit cup.  The cranberry orange butter was good, and the toast was cooked very well - thick toast, a little overcooked, but there just wasn't much flavor.    We also had the Breakfast Casserole which was good.  The menu said it had a pastry bottom, but the bottom of ours was just the eggs, no pastry bottom.    Great service.  Maybe we just came too late or on a bad day, but the food was just not that impressive.  For more on this review check out: http://hungrytotravel.wordpress.com

The breakfast here is amazing! Specifically the big breakfast... The only thing odd here is the parking situation but the service has been great the few times I've been here the atmosphere is great even though it is rather tiny in size but don't let that fool you

I wish I could give zero stars as our experience was not good.  We arrived early on Sunday so there was no wait. Our waitress came over quickly for our drink orders and then disappeared for about 15 minutes after giving us our drinks. We did not receive refills our entire meal. By the time we received our food it was cold. The red velvet waffle is overrated but it probably would have been better if it were hot.  Our waitress never came over to check on us or to ask how we were. We had to ask another waiter for ketchup.   We ended up waiting for our check and when we tried to get her attention, she blatantly ignored us. I would not return to this restaurant and I am glad we didn't have to wait for a table.

This is mediocre at best for dinner.  I have to assume the good reviews are based off a breakfast experience because our first time dinner experience was blah across the board.  It felt and tasted like an upscale cafeteria experience... not good.
Great time with friends and food was good. Could tell it was a new cook... Things were on the overly cooked side this visit but still one of my favorite spots of Charlotte.

Went for a walk to find dinner and happened upon the Terrace Cafe`, Ian C assisted me with some suggestions and I asked which would hold up as I walked back to my room. Ian offered the chicken strips. He was very friendly and courteous.   When I opened my container I found enough food for two! It was very good and more than I could eat. I hope to return for breakfast and would recommend anyone to try the place tucked around the corner from all of the other more fancier restaurants.

I had a feeling from their menu that Terrace would be a winner and I was right. We showed up at 10am on a Saturday as a party of 2 and waited about 20 minutes. Our waitress was bubbly and very attentive. The food was a bit slow but nothing egregious and she was very apologetic. We had carrot cake pancakes, a veggie omelet, and a side of chocolate chip pancakes. The pancakes are so fluffy! A great spot.

This is one of the few times that Yelp steered me wrong.  We stopped for lunch today prior to a nearby doctor's appointment and ordered the Angus Burger along with the Creole Filet Medallions.  I should have said something immediately when the latter arrived, as the meat was most certainly not filet.  I think it was sirloin.  It also was not medallions, as it wasn't a round cut, the sirloin was simply cut in half.  My companion said that the burger did not seem to have the taste or texture you would expect of Angus meat either, while the fries were too heavily salted.  The service was fine but having sirloin passed off as filet is pretty inexcusable.

I heard about Terrace Cafe not from Yelp or friends in Charlotte but from a friend in Texas and my sister in Indianapolis. When both of them mentioned Terrace Cafe's Red Velvet Waffle, I knew a meeting with said waffle would be in my future.   And today was that day. When I rolled up to Terrace Cafe, it was right before the churchie crowd and for some reason, I was expecting them to have a huge patio but no dice--just an inside dining area with an upstairs and downstairs.   I shouldn't have even looked at the menu but did against my better judgment and started to feel conflicted. I've been wanting that damn red velvet waffle for the past few months but then I started to see other tasty items like S'more french toast, a variety of eggs Benedict, etc but stuck to my guns and got the waffle.   It was everything I dreamed of and more. And from fear of going into sugar shock, I finished 3/4 of it and threw in the towel.   I had a skim latte which was smooth and light and priced the same as a Starbucks latte. The french press wasn't too shabby either. Service was fantastic and right on point. I definitely recommend this place for brunch--be sure to get there early though--they don't take reservations.

STOP, PUSH THE DIRECTIONS BUTTON, DRIVE HERE NOW!  This is a breakfast experience not to be missed. I think I might throw a tent up and stay here for a while and try all their items for the next several days. I ordered the banana/pecan waffles. They were amazing! They were perfectly prepared, fluffy, not doughey, flavorful and not too sweet - definitely gourmet. The menu is diverse with options to satisfy even the pickiest eater. Service was prompt and courteous. Cafe Au Lait was perfect. Can't say enough about this restaurant. We will come here every time we visit Charlotte!

I wrote a review about the other location, but I had to come back and write a review about this location as we were there just this past weekend per a request of my sister and brother in law when they came to visit.  My sister ordered the red velvet waffle, good as always.  My brother in law ordered Eggs benedict and a side of the biscuits and gravy.  Their gravy is one of the bests that I have ever had, I will have to remember to get a side of that in the future!  Kevin has some pork quiche.  I liked this much better than the quiche that I had last time at the other location.  This one was cooked better and just had a much better flavor.  Fantastic!  I had the special waffle - it was a cinnamon bun waffle.  It was the best waffle that I have had, and I really wish they would put this on their regular menu, it is fabulous!    My only complaint was that it took awhile for us to get seated, but food was fast and excellent!

We came a little after 1 on a Sunday afternoon.  The place was pretty full but we got a table right away. Despite how busy the place was there was kind of a calm ambiance, which my hubs attributed to strategic not-so-bright lighting and color scheme.  It feels like a nice place.  The sanitation rating inspired confidence too. I got a strawberry waffle with sausage, he got the quiche of the day (ham, cheese, broc and tomato).  My waffle was tasty, but then again, most waffles are.  The sausage patties had a little zing to them.  Hubs' quiche was promising but seemed to have been sitting for a little too long.  He said my quiches are better - to which you might say, of course he did, but he's more the type to say "hon, you've got to learn how to make this" if that is more true to the situation.  They had other items that looked interesting - crab benedict, for example, and some of their breakfast sandwiches - but between us we were neither wowed nor wigged out. The place is neither a deal nor highway robbery.  Overall it's kind of average.
Terrace Cafe is a gem.  Everything was fresh & delicious.  The staff was professional & friendly.  We will absolutely be back many times.
Good breakfast spot!  The service was great and sooo nice. Loved my egg white turkey omelette! And the banana pecan pancake was really yummy. Their biscuits are a must too.

I came here to visit family and they suggested this place. Long wait, but the service was fantastic. I ordered a hot chocolate that was absolutely delicious. Food was good but there was quite the wait for it. They almost forgot my soup appetizer, but apologized for the wait. A different daily drink every day; since we came on a Monday we had mimosas. They are famous for their red velvet waffles, but their lemon and poppy seed French toast is amazing!

We stopped in a for quick work lunch.  The service was prompt.  Even at 11:30 there was a good number of people already there which was a good sign.  The food was pretty good.  We had a variety of dishes.  My coworker really liked the shrimp and grits while my fried chicken sandwich was pretty good.  If you are in the area this could be a solid option.

Came here for the first time on a Wednesday evening at 6:30.  Me and my friend were a bit surprised to find that when we arrived we were the only people in the restaurant but this resulted in extra attention from our server. We started with the fried green tomatoes which were pretty good but not amazing. Then for our entrees I got the chicken and waffles and my friend got the shrimp and grits.  I've had some good chicken and waffles and although these did not quite reach the spectacular level it was still delicious enough that I would go back to get it again!

I go to the Ballentyne location all the time, and my food is always great. However, I have had several bad meals at this location. I stopped by for lunch, and waited 15 minutes before someone came over to greet me. I then waited over 30 minutes for my food to come out. The waitress kept saying that it wasn't ready yet. When it finally came out, it was not only overcooked but it was ice cold. There was also some sort of orange sauce splatted on my plate from someone else's meal. It was gross. Obviously, it had been sitting there for a long time. I didn't have another 30 minutes to wait for them to remake the food , I just wont be returning. This isn't the first time I've received cold food here.

This is the one place I like to bring out of town guest. It never disappoints. Customer service is generally good but today our servers seemed preoccupied but the he food is always delicious. Today I was freezing in here since I forgot my jacket, but everything else was exceptional! My favorite breakfast place in Charlotte!!! The red velvet waffles is delicious, I always get extra drizzle, but I generally don't use syrup because I'm not a fan of super sweet!!!

Went on a Sunday morning about 10. Got one of the last empty seats. When we came out there was a crowd waiting.   Food was good. Ordered the crispy chicken biscuit. It has some heat to it. The hashbrowns were ok. Nothing special. My husband really enjoyed his red velvet waffle. And my parents enjoyed their omelets.   The waiter left something to be desired. No personality. Made weird comments and never checked on us once the food was delivered. My husband didn't get his side of hasbrowns until after he had finished his waffle and we all needed refills.   The water also has a weird taste.

I visited Terrace Cafe with a friend while on an extended layover in CLT (it's only about 15-20 mins from the airport). The restaurant was a tad difficult to find, as it was tucked into a complex of office buildings interspersed with other restaurants among the buildings and courtyards. Anyway, parking was simple and free in the neighboring garage, so that made life easier.  The restaurant interior is fairly roomy. It's a large loft-like space with extremely high ceilings. It almost felt like there was a lot of wastage of space in the setup, but it worked if loft-like is what they were going for. Definitely not the place to go if you're looking for a more intimate ambiance.  The food was good...and unique breakfast selections! Normally you get the usual breakfast options, but Terrace Cafe has some interesting versions and flavors of pancakes and french toast and waffles and the like. They also have a variety of omelettes, among other breakfast choices.   My friend and I ordered the banana pecan french toast, the egg white veggie omelette, and a side of hash browns to share. The banana pecan french toast was interesting. They literally took banana bread and lightly coated it in french toast batter. It was good, but a little TOO sweet. Perhaps one of the other many french toast flavors would've been more suitable. The veggie omelette was great. Very healthy, not overly oily, and perfectly done. The hashbrowns were tasty and very crispy.  I'd recommend this place as a breakfast place to anyone visiting the Charlotte area. I really liked the variety and unique flavors of breakfast foods available.

Wow, less than impressed here! Placed a to-go order on the phone for mushroom crostini, shrimp po boy with no side and sweet tea. Showed up, was told to check with the bar.
