Bartender gave me unsweetened tea, had to ask for sweet and lemons. Got the sweet tea, had to ask again for lemons. And a straw. Didn't check the bag as I had to get back to training. Yummy smells had me digging into the bag in the car, only to discover no napkins and no utensils. Got back to training to eat, mushroom crostini was literally amazing, best thing about this whole experience! The po boy on the other hand sucked! 5 whole shrimp, no tarter sauce despite it being listed on the menu, very stale roll, slimy arugula and soggy fries.

This place has some of the best brunch I've had. I got the Lemon Poppy Seed French Toast and it was like eating lemon cake it was sooo good. Only items I didn't enjoy was the Turkey Bacon, it was too dry.   My girls friends each had waffles and chicken and no complaints from anyone! Will definitely be back for more.

I went here with my son for dinner one Wednesday night. I wasn't very hungry so I asked the waitress if I could have a waffle only (not wanting the 2 fried chicken breasts with the Chicken & Waffles). She said that wasn't a problem. Well, when she delivered the bill I was charged $17 for the waffle.  I reminded her I only got the waffle and I thought the price should be adjusted. She told me they didn't have time to "customize orders". The manager wouldn't take the time to come over and address the issue either. It was a very slow night in there (so he couldn't use the excuse he was too busy). There were only 2 other tables with customers in the  restaurant.   I will never go back here because my compliant was not addressed. The waitress couldn't even comprehend what I was telling her and the manager didn't want to be bothered.

10/17/15 Me: I need a Saturday brunch spot that kicks butt.  My friends and coworkers: You must go to Terrace Cafe!  Me: Well Ok!  Brunch is my favorite meal. I've been spoiled by all you can eat, everything included brunches...thanks DC :) so it's hard to find anything comparable to that experience in another city. I went ahead and decided to give Terrace Cafe a shot since it was so highly recommended by my friends and coworkers.   We arrived around noon and were seated within ten minutes of arrival. I put my name on the waitlist while my friend parked the car. Our table was ready before she entered the restaurant; the waitress stated that all party members, even though it was just two of us, need to be present before being seated. Luckily, my friend stepped in the door a few minutes after the news so this requirement didn't pose a problem for the beginning of our dining experience.  Our drink order was taken and we were given a few minutes to look over the menu. I asked the waitress for her recommendations, she told me two of her favorites but really didn't sell me on either as her recommendations were short, sweet, and lacked detail.  I was a bit surprised by the lack of information and decided to go with what looked good to me :).   My go to breakfast is French Toast, eggs, sausage or bacon, and hashbrowns.  Here the French toast stands alone as a menu item...bacon, eggs, etc are ala carte. This one little detail definitely influenced my final decision. I went with the Full Breakfast (Two eggs over easy, chicken apple sausage , cheese grits, and  substituted one slice of French toast for the two pancakes). Oh yeah, they have strict guidelines for substitutions and there is a charge to swap the pancakes for the French Toast. The French Toast was dense and lacked flavor. I saw what looked like cinnamon and maybe nutmeg sprinkled atop the bread but definitely did not taste it. The chicken apple sausage was delicious; I would definitely order that again. Finally, the eggs over easy and cheese grits were the most well prepared breakfast items for today's visit. Based on recommendations from trusted sources, I was expecting a better breakfast experience. I hope that my next visit will be more eventful.

There aren't as many great places to eat in Charlotte, so the few that taste exceptionally good, are usually busier than the rest.   The Terrace Cafe gets super packed during the weekend brunch service rush, so get ready for a bit of a wait.  PROTIP: The tables in the front near the bar, in the waiting area are first-come-first-served; so if you want to avoid an hour plus wait, snag one of those seats.  Onto the star of the show: the food is pretty solid here. The red velvet waffle was delicious and would highly recommend adding the fried chicken to that order. Otherwise, the food is very much brunch-like foods.   The service was spot-on and we didn't have to wait very long for help. The coffee here is superb as well and tasty.  Pros: great food for Charlotte Cons: the wait during the weekend is absurd

All I should have to say is...S'mores French Toast!!! But, then this wouldn't be a review!!   We ventured in for a late lunch a while back it wasn't very busy with just a few tables in there. I had the Buffalo Chicken sandwich it was ok nothing that really stood out to be bad but not that good either.  I forget what my boss ordered I know it was a special, but he didn't care for it. My sister had the Quiche it was ice cold and then had to sit there with nothing to eat because the server wasn't around...when he did come over he ran to the kitchen to get it fixed she said it was of course much better!!   Now the real reason this place is getting 3 stars is because of the S'mores French Toast that we decided to have for dessert!!! OMG this was ridiculously good!! I highly recommend it not for your entrée but to share with others as a dessert because it is huge and sweet!!
Best food for breakfast! I love their coffee and I've tried many different breakfasts and loved them all. The staff is great with service and very friendly. The wait is never too long either.

Food: I had the red velvet waffle, grits and biscuit & gravy.  The red velvet waffle is soft and not the crispy kind that you may get at some restaurant. On top of the waffle, they add white chocolate sauce and strawberry. Overall, it's pretty tasty. It's probably my fav thing here this far.   Grits is pretty blend. There's not enough seasoning on it. I may ask to upgrade to cheesy grits next time.  Biscuit and gravy: the biscuit is crispier than I would like. It's not those soft and fluffy kind. The gravy is pretty good. It has real chuck of ground beef not bitty tiny piece of ground beef which I can appreciate.   Customer service: the wait time is about 30 mins when we got here this morning. They promptly let us know when the table is ready. Our waitress is really attentive. The food came out in 10 mins. We are pretty happy with the service.   Location: The place is easy to find and free parking is right next to the building.
Great brunch! Gourmet waffles, French toast, pancakes, and wonderful service. Will surely become a must-have for us!

Terrace Cafe is a nice hip place for Brunch. We came on a Sunday morning and had no wait but it filled up quickly. We had two versions of their eggs benedict. The service was attentive and quick. Halfway through my Crab Cake Benedict I noticed an accumulating burnt flavor from the burn on the english muffins. I had already eaten half and it wasn't so noticeable that I didn't send it back. Otherwise I'd eat here again.

This place has absolutely amazing food, probably one of the best overall restaurants I've been to in Charlotte.  My last visit I had the special Jambalaya, which was amazing. There was plenty of shrimp, the grits were cooked perfectly and the onion peels were a really nice touch.  The shrimp and grits are also great, however the Tuna is probably the best thing on the menu. The kale & cranberry salad complements the tuna perfectly.  Definitely would recommend to friends.
The hummus appetizer was great as was the lemon poppy French toast. Cute atmosphere and great service too

In the words of my mama, wooooo child! Lol the best breakfast I've ever had hands down. The red velvet waffle was perfect! The chicke was well seasoned and the hash browns were fresh and on point. The mimosa didn't lack anything and actually gave us all a slight buzz. The rest of my party enjoyed their meals as well. From what i was told they had the best steak and eggs in the world. The steak was a small portion though. .. sort of pricey in all for breakfast but well worth it... th ey have a great selection. I would like to return and try a few other items on the menu....
Love this restaurant!! Have been here twice for lunch. Food was great both times! Wait staff does a great job. Everyone is very friendly. Awesome looking food for breakfast too!!

Ok Terrace Cafe. The food was pretty good. The hash brown are shredded and they don't have any onions on them, I suppose you can ask for that if you wanted it. I ordered the steak benedict, the steak came out cooked the way I asked. Unfortunately it came out with scrambled eggs, I sent it back and it came out like it was supposed to. My friend ordered the strawberry and french toast, it was decent. The BLT "was good" "it tastes like a BLT." That was the feedback from the BLT. I ordered an iced coffee with the brown sugar flavoring. It was decent. Our server was slightly forgetful, he jacked up out order and it took him a while to bring things we asked for. All in all the consensus at the table was our food was good. At the time we got there we didn't have to wait, if we would have, I think the rating would have been lower.

The below review was written by my husband....  Went on Sunday. Supposedly, you can't make reservations for Sunday, but I heard people doing "call aheads" ... which is the same as a reservation in my book! Put name on list for 15-20 minute wait. Waited more that 20 minutes. Went inside and asked for update. Hostess said she texted our phone twice with no response and then deleted our spot. We received absolutely NO texts. This happened to 2-3 other people that I personally witnessed. Other groups of more people arrived ahead of us, ate and left before us (on a day with no reservations). The chicken apple sausage used to be two links (I think) and now it's one link cut lengthwise. The crab cakes benedict were ok and my wife's pancakes were ok, but they didn't say that the cakes came with powdered sugar by default which is something she doesn't like. So, the wait and the "ok" food are enough of a reason to not go back for Sunday breakfast for quite a while. We loved our server and the hostess seated us immediately after I asked for an update. So, I'd have to say that the service was decent, but was  the overall experience compelling enough to warrant a return visit (any time soon)? No.
Red velvet waffles, tasty. Sunday brunch is a zoo - but worth the wait. Great coffee selection. Fresh, simple foods. Service needs some work but all in all a good thing going over at Terrace.

Seriously, there's just not too much more good stuff I can say about this place that the other reviews haven't mentioned.   So I'll just keep it simple and tell you what I like:   My absolute favorite item here is the Red Velvet waffle and of course you HAVE to add the chicken. It's the combination of sweet and savory that keeps me coming back again and again. I'm always changing up the sides but you can't go wrong with any of them.   I've never been disappointed here. This place is good for friends, out of town guests and good ol' Sunday brunch.   Get yourself there.

Tried the breakfast here for the first time and loved it!! My wife LOVED the shrimp and grits, and I really enjoyed the eggs Benedict. The atmosphere is pleasant and the staff was very friendly and attentive. Will definitely be back again to start our day of right!

I thought the food was absolutely delicious. I'm giving it a 4/5 because they wouldn't allow me to substitute the pancakes for a waffle when ordering the full breakfast. So I ordered the chicken and waffles instead and it was really good!!

Best brunch in Charlotte, no competition.  This place get absolutely packed on Sundays. Come early and bring yourself a book or buy yourself a few Bloody's. Or both. They have a Diablo (extra spicy), bacon Bloody and regular Bloody. I always get the bacon Bloody with a little extra spice. The latte's are also tasty and come in flavors ranging from blueberry to peanut butter. Can't speak on the blueberry, but peanut butter is phenomenal.  Unfortunately, they removed the s'mores french toast from the menu last year, which was my favorite, but they still have the famed red velvet waffle. Yes, you can also add fried chicken. Yes, it is as good as it sounds.  Grits are fluffy and creamy. Hashbrowns are shredded and deep fried - probably not made in house but still pretty good.   The biscuits and gravy and bacon, sausage and cheese sandwiches are delicious as well.  Go here. Seriously.

I've eaten at TC once before for brunch and have been wanting to make it back. They have great mimosas, cocktails and a famous red velvet waffle!  This time, we went in for brunch on a Friday. They do brunch M-S until 3pm, which is great. We need more places in Charlotte doing daily brunches! The hubs got a chai tea latte, which was very delicious. Perfect amount of foam and spice and not overly sweet. Also, it's served in a nice comfortable large mug.  I went with the Florentine Benedict with a side of Canadian Bacon. Pro tip: add the bacon to your benedict. Delicious and adds a whole new savory flavor dimension. The Benedict was very good, and the home fries were crispy, just as I like them! I stole some bites of my husbands lemon poppyseed French toast. It's served with icing and berries and comes with 3 pieces. I found the French toast slightly too crumbly, but my husband loved it!  Service was decent, though it was pretty busy on a Friday afternoon. Next time I'll have to get the fried chicken and waffles.

Terrace Cafe has a quality brunch menu.  The food is well seasoned and flavorful.  They are located in a nice walking area if you want to get a few steps in before or after the meal.  Their crab cakes eggs Benedict is my favorite dish on the menu.  Always delicious.  I've heard the red velvet waffles are amazing so I can't wait to try them on my next visit!  They have amazing shrimp and grits.  Be careful if you don't eat pork, they do put sausage in it.  I always substitute mind with the chicken sausage instead and it still tastes amazing.

I used to really like Terrace Cafe but the food and service has been declining. Our last visit was the last straw. It was a weekday morning so tables were readily available. It took a long time for the host to come back to the stand. That is fine. But the weird part is the two bartenders who were not busy at 10:30am looked at us like we're annoying - like we were interrupting their conversation. Then multiple servers made eye contact with us and walked by. Wouldn't it be normal to say good morning, we will be right with you? I truly felt like I walked into a private function and the dirty looks were to get us to leave. I was so close to leaving and I should have. We were taken upstairs and seated at a 2 top as close to a booth with very young and loud children. Then a table of four with a screaming child from the start was seated next to us. The other table dissolved into full blown on the floor meltdowns. We asked to move to the side of the top where no people were when we were originally seated. We quickly learned the upstairs is the child section as that section then had kids too. It was impossible to finish the crab cake Benedict given the screaming - meltdown screaming. Downstairs, there was not one table with children. Given that the food is mediocre at best, this was just unacceptable. When I asked the host why he would put two adults in the section that was clearly filled with kids, he said it was part of the rotation but did notice the tantrum  occurring on the floor. Oh well.
I really enjoyed my breakfast. I couldn't finish my steak and eggs so I took the rest to go. It was still good later on as a snack. The staff was polite. The atmosphere was peaceful.

Customer Service: My family and I have eaten at Terrace Cafe on many occasions, and never had the need to say anything negative about our experiences. We have always gone during the morning or early afternoon hours. On last Friday, (1-2-15) we ate at Terrace for dinner.   The cafe was mostly empty except for 3 other tables of patrons. My family placed our orders and my husband and I asked for "sweet" tea. First of all, the waitress took about 15 minutes to bring our drinks which I thought was very odd, considering there were so few patrons in the restaurant. When my husband and I tasted our tea, it was unsweetened!  Mind you, as I mentioned earlier, we have eaten at Terrace many times and have ordered their sweet tea most of those times. Each time, it has been appropriately sweet, even to the point of being too sweet.  This time however, the tea was definitely unsweetened. We told our waitress and she apologized and bought us out two more glasses of "sweet" tea. Again we tasted out tea and it was just like the first glasses, UNSWEETENED!!   This time, my husband walked to the front and told the waitress the tea was still unsweetened. 10 minutes later she comes to our table and says, " I'm sorry but I don't understand, I usually don't drink tea but I tasted the tea and thought it was sweet and my co-worker tasted the tea and she also thought it was sweet!  Are you kidding me!!!!! So what she was really trying to say is that there must be something wrong with our taste buds because we, the employees think it's sweet!! Mind you, I have tasted Terrace's "sweet" tea and it has always been appropriately sweet! I ended up canceling my drink order and just drank water.  So, here are my comments  to this situation:   Firstly, as your patron, please don't insult my intelligence by putting the burden of proof on the customer. In this situation, the customer is ALWAYS right! (Customer Service 101).  Secondly, The manager on duty usually comes to the patrons table whenever there is a dispute or misunderstanding of some type with the patron. The manager on duty never approached our table.  Thirdly, repeat customers are bred as a result of repeat positive customer experiences, even during challenges.  Finally, My family and I initially went to The Cheesecake Factory for dinner but had to wait 1 1/2 hours for a table. This was the reason for our dinner trip to Terrace. Terrace is known for it's long lines during breakfast hours but I wonder why there was hardly anyone there during dinner hours???? Hmmmmmm just an observation!!

What an amazing breakfast. It's been said over and over... Get the Red Velvet waffle!! We ordered it as an app so we could both enjoy. The breakfast casserole was wonderful. My BF got the Low Country Boil Hash special. Only came with 4 shrimp tho. For $16 I would expect more than 4. That's the only reason I give 4 stars. I really liked our server. He seemed really busy but never made us feel neglected. Great place!!!

Confused as to why this place is highly rated. Solid 3 stars at best. Service was great, but the food was mediocre. Our selections (chicken and waffles, french toast, and some egg soufflé) left us underwhelmed by the lack of "taste". Wouldn't  return.

Love coming here for breakfast. Never disappoints. Best biscuits and gravy in Charlotte. The staff is always friendly and have never gotten anything by great service. My go to restaurant for breakfast.
It's amazing the atmosphere & the great food fits right together if you love brunch/breakfast like i do it's the best spot
Awesome!!! The food and the waiter.  Other than the crazy NC law that meant I couldn't have a brunch mimosa this is one of the greatest brunches I have ever hat!

Hello....anyone there? That's what we kept asking when we could never find our server. The food is pretty decent but the service is awful.   If you're looking for breakfast I would go somewhere else. An hour meal takes you almost 2. For breakfast! Would not recommend

The first time I went to this restaurant about four years ago, I was blown away with service, the atmosphere, the variety on the menu and most importantly the food. We ordered their pancakes, fruit, shrimp and grits and a few other items. They were all amazing. We had a bit of a wait for our table but it was well worth it. (This was the South Park location). Then we went a second and third time and the wait was particularly long, the service was very average and while the menu didn't seem different, the quality of the food was significantly different. So we decided to try the Ballantyne location and we were shocked at the difference between the two locations. The Ballantyne restaurant didn't have as long of a wait and the menu was the same, but the restaurant itself was not very clean, the food did not taste good and the atmosphere was crowded and not very friendly. I have not since returned to this restaurant at either location.

I have been to the Ballantyne location for lunch before but I've yet to experience the legendary brunch I've heard so much about. Apparently everyone else has heard a lot about it because there was a 30 min wait. In fact they stayed on a wait during the entire time we were there. That's always a good sign.  We were seated at 11:30 and our waiter was right there to take care of us. We both got caramel lattes. I was impressed by their amazing coffee selection/espresso bar. It's not often that you find that in a restaurant. The coffee was delicious and came complete with some foam designs.  I got the eggs Benedict and it was delicious. I also got a side of the fried green tomatoes with pimento cheese. They were awesome!! My friend got the full breakfast and she enjoyed it. Service was excellent from beginning to end. Worth the wait!!!
Lots of yummy breakfast options. Only been for breakfast and service was good. Busy on Sundays which I'd expect. Terrace cafe is definitely one of my top breakfast spots.

Excellent place for breakfast or lunch. Bloody Mary's with bacon... What's not to love.  I try to visit here every time that I'm in town. Red Velvet waffles with fried chicken are a sweet and savory treat for breakfast.  For lunch I've enjoyed the crab cake BLT or the Nashville fried chicken.  Both are delicious and filling.  Service is fast and fantastic. This is great little cafe.

A must for breakfast! The staff is friendly, the restaurant is very clean, and food is always fresh and delicious! There is typically a wait on Sunday mornings but if you're willing to wait it's worth it.   Try the omelette and red velvet waffles!
I have try pretty much everything on the menu. The chicken and red velvet waffle is the best in my opinion.I had to take a moment to admire their latte art because it is just too cute!!!

I've heard a lot about this place and decided to visit while I was in Charlotte and was not disappointed. It is great for breakfast. I enjoyed the quick and friendly service despite the long wait lines (hence the 4 instead of 5 stars) although I will say it was completely worth it. I ordered the signature red velvet waffle with cream cheese frosting/syrup and it was especially delicious with a side of fruit. I recommend this place to anyone looking for a great breakfast/brunch.

I love this place! I loved that we were able to grab bar seating on a Sunday at noon the moment we walked it. We were able to "skip" the line because of bar seating. YES! I felt awesome because of this. Bar seating was definitely a great experience especially for our first time at Terrace Cafe as the bar is right next to the kitchen. I can see the chefs working hard to ensure that the plates of food are set correctly before sending them out to patrons to enjoy. I enjoyed observing the chefs work while I enjoy my meal.   FOOD - Steak & Eggs || two perfectly cooked filet medallions, two eggs, and choice of either grits or hash browns -- I ordered both. I requested my filet medallions to be medium and they were just perfect. I ordered my eggs over easy and placed them on top of my sliced and toasted croissant. I was scared my hash browns were going to be soggy and not crispy so I ordered them to be well done or extra crispy; however, I found out that this is not needed as mine were too crispy. The Steak & Eggs were just perfect. It's a must order. I'm craving it at this moment! - Eggs Benedict - Filet || two filet medallions, two eggs, and hollandaise sauce all on top of biscuits with a side of hash browns. Very nice twist to eggs benedict. If you're craving steak and eggs benedict at the same time --- you should try ordering this.  - Long Island Peach Tea || Adult Drink -- very good and very strong. i love the twist that they have to the traditional Long Island by adding Peach flavors. - Pineapple Guava Sangria || Adult Drink -- this drink was very light as it only has white wine and is mixed with lots of fruit juices like guava and pineapple. Something you should order if you're looking for a light adult drink with your meal.  SERVICE/AMBIANCE/LAST NOTES Service was impeccable. I know we sat a the bar and service should be the best since we are right next to the kitchen, but I can see that if we sat at a regular table, our service would be impeccable as well as you see the servers working hard to get food out to patrons. The restaurant is surprisingly very spacious as there are tables upstairs and downstairs. Parking is free as you can park around the complex. If there is a wait, please see the hostess, give your name and phone numbers and she will text you when you're table is ready.   Overall, this is my favorite restaurant by far this weekend and I will definitely come back to visit Charlotte because of Terrace Cafe. Many friends suggested that I should try the Red Velvet Waffles with a drizzle of cream cheese -- which I will try on my next visit as it is a very popular item!

Honestly, can anyone in their right mind rate this place below a 5?    Lets break it down for someone who hasn't been here:  The food is ALWAYS (and I mean every single thing I have ever ordered) right and tastes great, even when they are slam packed, which is often.   There are some fun things on the menu (especially breakfast) that you would be hard pressed to find anywhere else.  Ex. red velvet waffle, WOW  The staff is always busy but always friendly  My only complaint is that they are so damn good they get busy and there is often a wait but I can't hate on them for being too popular!!!!!

Waffle was good flavor but very soft more like a pancake.  Latte was very good.  We also had an omelet which was good along with nice crispy hash browns.  I am giving a 3 because of our waitress.  Service could have been better.  The waitress wasn't the friendliest, when we asked questions she answered very fast and seemed annoyed when we asked her to repeat what she said.  She didn't come around to our table much to check on us either.  Because of the lack of good service it took away from the experience.  The food was good and no real complaints but service needs work.

May I vent first thing about Piedmont Row, not Terrace Cafe?  I was all excited about trying TC, I decided to meet  one of my friends for an early lunch.   I hop on my bike, a brand new orange Electra Townie no less and park it in between Terrace Cafe and Dolcetto, two businesses that we should frequent so they can thrive.  Don't you know some man from somewhere does not like my bike locked  to a light post, rats me out to the security guard and there is a ruckus to get me to move my bike.We had already been seated and ordered and our food was on the tray on the way out of the kitchen.  I am in the restroom and  my friend sees them shaking my lock and  looking at my bike, she goes out and they tell her to park it somewhere else.  My friend said, "our food is on the way, can't we move it in a minute?"  It had to be taken care of that instant.    What were they going to do?  Fine me?  Tow my bike?  Jeez.  I moved it, but now I think I should have protested.  WTF?  Anyway, back to the matter at hand.    Terrace Cafe....  When I arrive, I  order some coffee, my friend shakes her head and makes me try her coffee first.  WEAK.  Am I the only person that hates weak coffee in a breakfast establishment?  I don't want cowboy coffee, I just want some decent coffee.  So, I order a latte.  A beautiful latte comes out.  Yeah!!!   I vacillate between breakfast and lunch, what a big decision.  Lunch wins, I decide on a half sandwich and 2 soups.  Interesting.  The concept of two soups, why make a decision, have both!!!  Boo, they were redundant.  Two broth soups.  The server said chicken noodle and vegetable.  Maybe it was my Campbell soup upbringing thinking veggie soup was tomato, my bad.   The BLT was thick sourdough bread, one slice was soggy, they were slathered in butter and then barely toasted.  Tomatoes had been in the fridge.  I think they care, but maybe just need some honest feedback.    My server was very nice and sincere and she was appalled that they made me move my bike. Even the security guard thought the guy was crazy too.    Did I mention I had to move my bike to the back of the shops at Piedmont Row near the YMCA?    I will go back to Terrace Cafe, they did have cocktails, so I am going back for breakfast and a bloody mary.  I will park my bike near the Y, so the uptight man can get on with his work and not be bothered with the eyesore of my Townie parked at a light post. GASP.  Follow up: went today (2oct) with another friend, we sat at the bar and ordered bloody marys and an order of onion rings.  The bloody marys were fabulous and garnished with bacon, need I say more?  Since my return, the coffee was much better!!!

My friend had eaten here and told me how she got food poisoning because half way through eating her food, she found that there was mold on the fruit. She told them about it, they apologized, she paid, the end.   I thought by her telling them about their spoiled fruit, they would be more careful about it. I was craving their SEC biscuit today and wanted the fruit as a "healthier" side. Biscuit was good as usual and I even checked the fruit to make sure. It looked good but as soon as I picked up the raspberry, there was a blueberry underneath covered in mold!!!! Ewwwwww! I can't believe it happened to me too!!   I was so upset I took the cup of fruit back to show the manager and his respond was "I apologize, do you want another cup of fruit?" Was he waiting for me to say "Yes, please give me another cup of fruit full of mold. I've been waiting all my life to eat that!"?   How about give me back the money I spent on that nasty cup of fruit that I don't want? But of course he didn't offer. Of course I had to pay for that with the mold in it.   Please stay away from this location! Bad fruit and bad management overall.

I was excited to try this place because the pictures looked great however it left me a little disappointed. I took a seat at the bar while I waited for a table during a busy Sunday brunch. Service was good and I ordered a Terrace Bellini which was fantastic. After a little while, the table was ready so we were sat in the dining area. I ordered the red velvet waffle with fried chicken (which I had eyed hungrily while sitting at the bar with order after order of these going out) and my girlfriend ordered a build your own omelette with vegetables. My food arrived but it was a little cold and not as good as I had hoped. The chicken skin wasn't crispy but had good flavor. I tasted my girlfriend's omelette and it tasted like they hadn't used any salt at all. This place definitely has potential but they need to work on their execution.

Ok, so we had been trying to get to this restraunt for a few months. We decided to go last night for my fiancee's birthday, and was that the biggest mistake we ever made? Yes. The night started off with ham and pimento cheese sliders which were so salty, I must have gone through 2 waters and an unsweet tea just to wash the taste out of my mouth. The barbacue sauce on the frenched chicken drummette's was waaaaaay to sweet and overpowered by the amount of ketchup and sugar they must have made it with. For dinner, the fried southern chicken came with green beans that had absolutely NO seasoning, mashed potatoes that were too salty, and gravy on the chicken that was salty. The filet came with a sauce on it that tasted like sh*t. I mean, there was no other way to describe it, and when I'm spending $25 on an 8oz filet, I at least want to be able to eat it. I mean, it was so disgusting. The sauteed mushrooms, I actually had to put salt and pepper on them. I have NEVER EVER done that at a restraunt. It's like they don't season half the food and overseason the other half. No balance anywhere. The dessert wasn't as bad, but how can you mess up a cookie? Especially one that Cracker Barrel also has but their's is way bigger and costs $5 less. The red velvet bread pudding wasn't that bad but it was way too thick and pastey. It was the WORST experience I have ever had with food at a restraunt. They need Gordan Ramsey so bad, wow. DO NOT EAT HERE. I'm paying for it today. O, and the waiter was so awkward, just kind of hovering around our table. Really strange.

We've been here twice. Both times there was a wait, it seems as if there is ALWAYS a wait on a Sunday late morning/early afternoon. The service is nice. The food is great. The first time we had the stuffed french toast. IT WAS AMAZING! When we returned, it said they were french toast sticks, not sure why they changed it. Also, the first time we had the chicken and waffles. IT WAS AMAZING! The chicken was fried to perfection and the waffle was so yummy.   This recent time we ordered the Lemon Poppy french toast, which tasted more like a pound cake, but it was AMAZING! We also ordered the special for that day which was a chocolate chip waffle, with white chocolate drizzle. I was also amazing and not super sweet or chocolatey.   This is in our Yelp "Favorites" collection.

FANTASTIC! Decor: A+, Staff: A+, Food: A+!  Just ate a delicious "full breakfast" (scrambled eggs, bacon, hashbrowns, & 2 pancakes + fruit cup). So yummy! Hashbrowns were perfect! Just the way I like them - shredded! Matt was a great waiter, too!

Used to come here on a regular basis- admittedly it was always for breakfast or lunch. Went for dinner last night and was extremely disappointed. Has this place changed ownership? Something has gone awry. Wine had to be sent back. Calamari appetizer came out cold and chewy. (When it was replaced with a hot version, it was delicious though.) Half of our party's entrees were delicious- but half came out completely cold.  We finally gave up sending cold items back. What was going on in the kitchen?? Service was so slow I had to take mine to go in the end. Server was pleasant but slammed. Manager does not go out of his way to be particularly pleasant. This used to be one of our go-to restaurants.  Not any more.

Yum this place is so good.  I had a chance to stop in for lunch and I was just as impressed with my lunch selection as I was when I had dinner here.   If you get a chance the roasted red pepper & gouda soup is out of this world amazing.  This place is hopping during lunch.  The food and service were both excellent.  Now I must make it back for some brunch next time.

Came for brunch on a Sunday around 930am and it was perfectly open with tables available. We walked in and were seated immediately. I've been to the Ballantyne location several times and have loved it.   Ordered the BBQ Chicken quiche for my entree and where I can say it had great flavor, it definitely lacked in structure. Think it was just a matter of being cooked long enough, but it was definitely falling apart. Also, the dressing on the salad as a little wonky. I did love that the fruit on the side had the option of being all berries. Big plus.   The rest of the meal was stellar per usual. Killer oatmeal, hashbrowns, orange juice, and silly, tilty glasses.   Keep it rockin', Terrace. You've got a space in my heart. Cheers.

This is a new restaurant that opened up in the trendy mixed use (residential/commercial) area called Piedmont Row.  Very close to South Park mall.     A very welcomed addition!  Although I stopped in at lunch time, they have a great breakfast menu.  Will is great to have another option other than the Original Pancake House in the S Park area.  Lunch was great and the service was friendly.  I sat at the bar area and ordered a Buffalo Chicken Sandwich.  Was cooked perfectly.  Sitting at the bar, you could see the kitchen area and you could tell they were still working some of the bugs out on the computer system and still perfecting the food presentation.  Still, there was nothing that prevented the service and food from being wonderful.  I can not wait to get there for breakfast!

The red velvet was good,but I've tasted better...Just being honest...The server was on point...The shrimp and grits was very good...I must say it was different...So Come try them out...Nice environment and very nice people

Awesome food and great service!  Had the fish and chips and it was amazing!  Huge portion of fish.  Definitely want to try the red velvet waffle!  Crab cake appetizer was great too.  Really enjoyed my meal.

I'm just gonna jump right to it. Today was my last visit to TC. I have been coming here since around 2009, 10 and it's dived into a giant pool of mediocre. I'd say over the last 3 visits they have pretty much missed on everything. Today, we literally had the overall worse service  EVER! We waited over 45 minutes to be seated and people who came after us were seat before us. Once seated, we waited for water/drinks. After our food was served, we waited for utensils, we waited for coffee refills,  we waited for our check. We pretty much blew a whole Saturday on breakfast. They were very slow at cleaning the tables around us as we ate and those tables sat empty longer than expected. The larger parties received quick service and more attention and had I'd been paying, I wouldn't have left a tip at all. I felt totally disregarded as a customer from the moment I stepped in, until I walked out. There are much better breakfast /brunch spots in Charlotte. I will spend my time and money there.
This place has to be the best breakfast/brunch spot in Charlotte. Omelets and hashbrowns are great.
A la carte pricing isn't my favorite thing but the food is good. Nice atmosphere, parking, not bad....

I was super excited to try Terrace after reading so many great reviews and also because of the vegan breakfast they have on the menu. To say that I was disappointed doesn't even begin to describe my experience. Our server was not only condescending and not very knowledgeable about the menu, she was not attentive at all. In fact, she came across as bored. Her behavior was an immediate turnoff. The food was "okay." I'm sure the non-vegan fare is amazing but the vegan offering wasn't seasoned well and was over cooked. I had to ask repeatedly for my coffee to be refilled, and they kept giving everybody in our party the wrong order. It was a chaotic nightmare.   The only saving grace was that my company was fantastic so the conversation made the very poor service tolerable.   I will not be returning, at least not to the Southpark location. Perhaps the Ballantyne location has better trained servers.

Every time I am in Charlotte I come here. I have never been disappointed. It gets packed though and there can be a wait. It is well worth it.  The location is great because you can park in the deck and there is always parking. It is a smallish place, but they have some seating upstairs and a small bar as well.  I love the bloody mary here. The best anywhere. I love the hash browns and the red velvet waffle - OMG - to die for! Really good coffee drinks and great service.  The last time I went, some friends were in the area and wanted to join us, but we only had a table for 4. So we asked the server if we could add 3 more people and they moved the tables around to accommodate us, even though they were pretty busy at the time. I was really happy that they were able to do that, since I was visiting and wanted to be able to spend more time with my friends.  I have had dinner here as well and it has been awesome, but I keep coming back to the breakfast because it ROCKS!!!!  I wish they had these on the west coast!!!

The red velvet waffle has to be my favorite. The atmosphere is nice, and the service is good. If you want to try new things there are a lot of twist to our regular entrees; such as, their chicken salad. Also, if they have tomato bisque, it is a must!

Long wait on Sundays If you are interested in going for Sunday brunch, make sure to get there early/reservation. The food was ok.  I had the French toast.  Northing great or bad about it.  It was just French toast. I'm giving it more stars based on the ambience of the restaurant.

Remember the days, when you thought you had to eat at Waffle House, IHOP, or Cracker Barrel for breakfast on Saturday or Sunday mornings?  Not so much because they were especially great or anything, but maybe because you knew they were there for you, and could be counted on to provide a hearty and delicious breakfast, time and time again.  WELL, those days are over my friends.  Say, hello to Terrace Cafe.  I'm usually not one to dote over the intricacies of the decorations and feng-shui of a place, but Terrace Cafe truly has a remarkable interior.  The second you walk in, you are transported to a wonderful and peaceful cafe seemingly somewhere in the  Mediterranean.  My gf and I arrived there around 10am on Sunday morning, and were seated immediately with no wait.  We were taken for a nice walk throughout the restaurant, and upstairs to a table in the balcony overlooking the entire restaurant (see pics).  For breakfast, i ordered the Steak and Eggs w/ hash browns and an English muffin.  I order this every time I go here, maybe just switching up the English-muffin for toast.  It's not that I think the other menu choices will be less than satisfactory, but because the Steak and eggs are out of this WORLD!!  It comes with 2 or 3 eggs any way you like, and two steak fillet medallions (see pic).  These little medallions are as good as any steak I've had.  No sauce needed.  No knife needed.  Just good, tender beef.   My girlfriend ordered a pecan waffle with the fresh fruit cocktail as a side.  She loved it.  The waffle was cooked to perfection (I just had to eat some).  Warm syrup was also brought to the table just before the food arrived.  She loved the waffle as well as the fruit.  Explaining that the fruit was fresh and sweet.  As for the service...It was magnificent.  Nothing else needs to be said.    I'm a fan of everything about this place. Ive been here three times (all for breakfast) and have had tremendous dining experiences each and every time.  I do not have a single complaint about my dining experiences there - ever; in the three times I've been there.   Terrace Cafe is the BEST BREAKFAST SPOT IN CHARLOTTE!!

Wow!  What a wonderful find!!  I visited the Terrance Cafe for brunch one Saturday and it was wonderful.  My boyfriend had a Bloody Mary, it was garnished with a piece of bacon (he loved it) and my mimosa was fantastic.  The blueberry fritters that they were handing out were to die for and my sensible egg white omelet was to die for.

The service torpedoed this review from 4 stars to 3. I went for breakfast and my eggs were cool when served. Not good. The staff made an effort to replace the eggs. I wouldn't say it took long to get the replacements, but by the time the warm eggs arrived, the rest of the meal had cooled down.  I went ahead and ate the breakfast and it would've probably been really good had it been served piping hot. To give the benefit of the doubt, Terrace was VERY busy which means they must get it right most of the time. Maybe it was just bad luck for me. My girlfriend did enjoy her breakfast.  Anyway, aside from that, the atmosphere of the place is quite nice. Its contemporary American and very lively for a morning spot. I'd probably give them another shot if I lived in the area but I was jut passing through.  Oh, and the final nitpick, the bill charged for 2 orders of eggs. The staff removed the additional order.

So glad i found this place!  I am big on brunch and was looking for a new brunch spot in charlotte and this is certainly it! I had the red velvet waffles and they were absolutely delicious and very filling. Everything ordered at our table was great, i will definitely be back. A+ for the presentation as well, i love food that looks almost too good to eat  Highly recommended for brunch.

I am incredibly disappointed to give such a poor review. I was so excited to try this place, especially the crab cake blt. I do have to note that the flavors of the dish were fine, not wonderful, but good enough to pay for. However my mother found two short black hairs on her plate. Neither of us have short black hair. The inexcusable part was the manner in which it was handled. The server was rude and unapologetic. And shockingly only half of the cost of the meal was removed from the bill. It is pretty standard in my opinion that when a dish is deemed inedible due to sanitation issues, it should be completely taken off.

I found the Terrace Cafe with a "Weekday Brunch in Charlotte" Google search. I had a friend in town for a job interview and we were in desperate need of a brunch spot. I was ill-prepared for just how many restaurants only have weekend brunch. All of that to say, my expectations weren't super high.   We began our brunch with the only downside of the experience--an extremely long wait! There were empty tables all around and folks were moving in and out somewhat quickly, but it. took. forever. Luckily, the wait was worth it. I ordered the Red Velvet Waffle. I was both excited and nervous about the choice. I mean, I LOVE some red velvet ANYTHING, but I'm also not a huge fan of exceedingly sweet dishes--especially for breakfast. I'm the girl that can only handle like 1/4 of a cupcake at a time. Max. The waffle was DELICIOUS, though, and just the right about of sweetness without being at all overpowering. My friend ordered the Lemon Poppy French Toast and was equally impressed! Our waiter was exceedingly charismatic, attentive (without being annoying), and just wonderful!  It was a somewhat accidental stumble-upon adventure. But, it was an all-around great experience and I will certainly be back!

went to terrace cafe for breakfast this morning for a quick meeting.  i wasn't starving so i ordered a bacon/cheese biscuit which came with hashbrowns.  the food was good but not great.    the cafe was pretty busy for a wednesday morning and our waiter had a party upstairs so the service could have been better but i'd probably give it another try when i have a bigger appetite.

Call me a rebel, but I think their dinner is better than their brunch.  I've had brunch at Piedmont once and brunch at Ballantyne once and both were great (my friends love the bacon in the bloody mary) but dinner is some of the best upscale Southern food I've had.    The only reason I don't go more often is sometimes I'm too hungry to endure the wait, but if I plan ahead and make reservations it all works out.

What a unique and delicious place to go to for brunch on a Sunday morning (or any day really)! I went into terrace restaurants so excited to try their unique and drooling breakfast items and it didn't disappoint. They have so many things to choose from and if anyone is in NC, I will tell them Terrace Restaurants is a must go to! In addition, for it being Sunday brunch, it was not packed at all!  Tried: Fried chicken and red velvet waffle Carrot cake pancakes * BOTH were spot on !

I moved to Charlotte about a year and a half ago and this is where I take all of my visitors for breakfast or brunch. The chicken and waffles here are the best! The grits are really good and so are the fish and chips. They do not take reservations so there is usually a wait but it is worth it! Sometimes you can get a seat at the bar when you first go in.

My experiences with the food and drink are far better at weekend mornings/brunch service than on weekdays. On good days, the bar makes a very tasty chai. On not-so-good days, it's watered down and not blended well. Recommended dishes: red velvet waffle, Terrace French toast, bacon or pecan waffle. The s'more waffle is too sweet for a meal, it works well as a dessert, though. The service has always been good even when they're slammed. If you're planning to go Sunday for brunch, plan to wait for a table due to this place's popularity, but it's worth it of you plan for it.  They will not seat you until your entire party is present.
Seth, my waiter, was super cool. Red velvet waffle, fried chicken & cheese grits are like Holidays status like yo very own mama or grandma took they time to welcome you home type meal!!

I really like this cafe. For once, a restaurant that exceeded my expectations. If I'm ever back in Charlotte I'll make a return visit for brunch.   Prices are right. Service was great. Food is done with care.  My mother ordered the beef soup and a half order of a turkey sandwich. The beef soup surprisingly came with collard greens in it, and the turkey sandwich was filled with grilled onions, melted cheese, chopped turkey, and crispy bacon.  I ordered the Egg Benedict Floratine and I appreciated the care that was taken with the dish. It came topped with crispy fried onions, and the spinach was correctly sautéed.   Only complaint is the chairs need an upgrade, and the lower level dining room floor plan could have been designed better without placing restrooms facing patrons as they eat.

Love, love, love. I have only been for breakfast but it is amazing. I got the waffle and fried green tomatoes, nice portion.  Coffee is good. Quality of food is outstanding. For the price can't beat it. Will be back.

Red velvet waffles and chicken are the only dish I can personally speak for as I can't seem to try anything else.  The waffle is nice and crisp on the outside and soft moist and flavorful on in the inside.  The cream cheese drizzle is the icing on the cake, no need for syrup.  The chicken is extremely moist and well seasoned and fried to perfection.  I get ranch as my dipping sauce and it  too is delicious and fresh made.    The sweet tea never disappoints and they also make a delicious cup of coffee.  My kids love their pancakes and bacon.  My husband enjoyed their shrimp and grits when he's not getting chicken and waffles.  I have found the food and service to be better going during the week vs. on Sunday's for brunch.  This could be because of the crowd for Sunday brunch.

Overrated!  Big long line on Sunday and sadly, it wasn't worth the wait. Although was our waitress was nice, she was not attentive. The fried green tomatoes had no flavor. My crabs cakes were burnt and too salty. The hash browns were only toasted on only one side and the remaining were snow white!!  My turkey bacon was totally limp and undercooked. Mimosas had no garnish and no bubbles.

This is an wonderful breakfast/brunch restaurant! The turtle latte is a must! We always get the Steak Benedict and they always cook it perfectly! We've order the following:  Banana Pecan Toast - this was delicious but definitely on the sweet side. If you don't like sweet items, do not order this.   Steak Benedict - this was my favorite! Ordered with a side of hash browns added mushrooms, onions and cheese on top.   Spicy Chicken Biscuit - this was spicy! The pimento cheese is a great combo BUT the ghost peppers aren't a joke.   Shrimp and grits - this definitely had a true Cajun flavor.

This is my absolute favorite place for brunch - any time of day, every day! The food is delicious and the restaurant itself is classy and quirky.   My favorite thing to order is the red velvet waffle - everyone should try it at least once (AT LEAST!!). I wasn't as impressed with the Banana Pecan French Toast, which was drowned in maple syrup to the point of being as soft as apple sauce. Nonetheless, at least the flavor was still good. I've also tried a latte here before (I forgot the flavor), which was tasty and had cool latte art.  I read a lot of review with complaints about long lines, but each time I've been I've gotten a seat immediately. I went on weekdays both times and the first time I went was after 1pm while the second time was after 7pm.

So when we first got here we waited quite a while (my party is a group of 7) . We watched several party's be seated and receive their food . In the same time we didn't even get a drink order for ten minutes , come to find out there was a party of 16-20 that was seated quick and received their food ( explains why it took so long) . My table didn't get to order at the same time until the manager showed up (who was friendly).  The food was really good . Everyone enjoyed . However the service was slow and w happened to be the only ones left in the restaurant waiting to end our service . Regardless , if you have time to WAIT . Cool.

Perfect spot to munch on quality food.  EZ parking, warm interior, wide selection, and friendly staff make 4-stars a no-brainer IMO.  I'm a simple breakfast eater, mostly due to diet restrictions, so I cannot comment on their sweet stuff (although those red velvet pancakes were popping up on every table--damn those high carbs!).  My omelet was cooked perfectly and served piping hot.  I opted for some cheesy grits which were OK (everyone said try the hash browns but I panicked and forgot).  My server, Julie, was a joy and I hope Mgt notices her contribution.  Thanks for a well-rounded experience.  I'll bring Lori next time and sit upstairs sipping mimosas while holding hands :)

I have been here a handful of times in the past and it was pretty good.  I went this week and it was terrible.  The food just didn't taste good and came out sort of warm.  The staff seemed too busy taking pictures of stuff that day and we were one of only 3 tables of people.  My friend asked for some salsa to try to add some flavor to her eggs and there was a $3 charge for it on her bill, which she was not told about ahead of time.  I had several $1 charges on my bill for random things also not mentioned to me.  My omelette and my one year old's kids meal was $30.

The food was good but if you're going there on a weekend to sit at the bar, don't expect the best service. It took at least ten minutes for someone to actually come over and say anything to me. I had to yell to someone over the noise "can I get a menu?" Finally when the girl said she was coming to wipe down the area where I was sitting, she never came back so when I saw her again I had to ask if she was going to wipe it down. She said "we're super busy I'm so sorry I'll get to it as soon as I can." She finally came back five minutes later wiped it down and finally asked what I wanted, 15 minutes after I'd arrived. Then some woman, who is barely dressed, halter top, skin showing, boobs out, THE WORKS, comes in, sits at the bar, takes off her expensive sunglasses and places her expensive purse down, and all the staff behind the bar come rushing to her asking what she needs, does she want water, how's she doing. Its funny because even with all her expensive possessions, she was asking "well how much if I do this or that?" If you can afford those expensive glasses but can't buy some eggs, get your priorities in order. All I can do is look like "well perhaps next time I'll show a little more skin and flash a flirty smile so people will wait on me hand and foot." It's amazing what people will do when they "think" customers have money. This is crazy. I thought I left crap like that in Atlanta but I guess it's all the same in Charlotte. (ps chick took a pic of her food to post on Soc media when it came, wow. Real classy) Thanks for the omelette tho, Terrace Cafe. -Sincerely, Frustrated ISU Doc Student on a writing break looking for good food and service
Awesome brunch and dinner us actually pretty good. Red velvet waffle is to die for. Must try if you are looking for a great Sunday brunch.
I have only ate here once but the food was great. I had the shrimp and grits. It's a tad pricy and can be very busy with long wait times! I would still go back..cute atmosphere!
The recommendations were right on the money here...I also had an outstanding server whose name is Tashi...thanks for the great service

Every Sunday I try to convince myself to branch out and experience a new brunch place in Charlotte. And every Sunday without fail I'm back here again. I just can't get enough of this place. The Bavarian Creme Stuffed French Toast and Red Velvet Waffle are currently dueling for top spot on the sweet side. The Southern Biscuits and Gravy reigns supreme as far as savory is concerned.   The food is 5 stars all the way, but the service has often left something to be desired. Granted, I'm going during what I imagine is their busiest time on their busiest day of the week, but I always feel a bit like an inconvenience to the wait staff.   I also struggle to understand a brunch place that doesn't incorporate bacon as a preset side, particularly with their sweet dishes. When asked if the hash browns or grits that accompany the waffles could be switched out for bacon, I've always been told no, not even for an extra charge. And $4.25 is just too extravagant a price for a few strips of bacon.    Apart from those aspects though, I've always left overly full and overall pleased.   Pro tip: if visiting on a Sunday at prime time, put your name on the list and walk around the corner for a manicure at Cachet. By the time your nails are drying, you should be getting a text that your table is ready.

Went for lunch for the first time today, and it was awesome. I had the chicken and waffles which were delicious! The chicken was some of the best I've ever had!! I definitely recommend checking this place out.

Good job, Terrace Cafe and all who make you who you are.  As a connesiuer of fine brunch establishments, only Toast Cafe in Davidson delivers a comparable breakfast.  I applaud your effort and achievement in the breakfast arena.  The wait, which I expected, was worth it.  The decor was unconventional, a mesh of three themes, diner/cafe/loft.  Although you would wonder how those concepts can be welded together into one , Terrace Cafe you have pulled it off.

I had the "RED VELVET WAFFLES" with cream cheese drizzle. Talk about light, fluffy and delicious this waffle was terrific, it came with a fried chicken breast which to me was a little dry, but hey it's a chicken breast. LOL! The restaurant was very busy, we went on a Sunday around 1:30 PM even though they were crowded, we were seated fairly quickly and served in a reasonable amount of time. We had a group of 10 and our waiter was very good. I would also recommend you get the white mocha coffee

Tried this place with my wife for valentine's weekend breakfast.  The adventure started with one of the rudest hosts that we have ever encountered. Waited while he sat people he knew in front if us and empty tables were visible. Waitress and wonderful food made up for the awful host. Try the red velvet waffles.  They are fabulous.

Disappointed. I've been to Terrace before for breakfast and it was good, but skip this restaurant for dinner. Not enough bread for our table and it took forever to take our order. They were severely understaffed for dinner service. Waited at least 20 minutes for our waitress to return our bill so we could pay and leave. Our waitress wasn't at fault: it was management who gave her no support.
Pretty standard brunch options. Average wait for Charlotte. Love their coffee; they serve Magnolia which is locally-roasted. Family-friendly; good amount of parking in the garage.
Big portions and very good food. I had the biscuits and gravy he and my partner had the crabcakes.

Chicken and Waffles!  Scrumptious!! The waffles are thick and fluffy. The chicken is hot, crispy, tender and juicy inside! Add hot buttered grits and Tadaaaaa!  Service is fast. Parking is plentiful. Prices are very good! Food is delicious and there are a lot of options to choose from. Breakfast, sandwiches, entrees, sides, u name it! They have it!

I had a 5 hour layover in Charlotte last week so a friend picked my husband and me up at the airport for a nice breakfast. Hence how we ended up at the Terrace Café. What a treat that ended up turning into.  I had the sausage gravy over biscuits. I'm a big fan of Bob Evans S&B but don't live near one now so I'm always looking to top the deliciousness of those. The Terrace Café exceeded my expectations. The biscuits where light and fluffy and the sausage (made fresh in their kitchen) was tasty but not greasy. The perfect blend of flavors in a light creamy gravy. It came with a side salad which I thought was a bit weird for breakfast and then regretted that I didn't eat it since later my husband and our friend told me it was really good with a light dressing that was actually complementary to the meal (so what do I know?).  Our friend had the eggs benedict which he raved about and my husband had the full breakfast which included eggs, bacon and pancakes. Being quite the connoisseur on pancakes my husband raved about them.  The only complaint I had was that I thought they must have been packing meat in their dining room because it was FREEZING in there. When I asked the waiter about it he told me that apparently it gets so warm in the afternoon that they have to keep it cool in the morning. That's great for the afternoon diners but why should I have to be uncomfortable to accommodate later diners? We were all uncomfortably cold and left as soon as we were finished eating which was too made because we would have liked to hang out a bit have more coffee and visit. My husband even said that by the time he got to the end of his meal it wasn't warm any longer. Now THAT'S cold.  Overall though the food was wonderful and I'd definitely recommend it. You may however want to try it in the afternoon!
Great service. Great food.  Honestly, our server did not have a lot of personality but he was incredibly efficient. I'm fine with that. The food is definitely worth the price tag.

Not too long of a wait, but a packed house, which was a good sign that Terrace Cafe is the place to be on a Sunday for brunch.   Took my mom and her friend here since I've heard this is a great place to eat and treat! The atmosphere was very nice, spacious, and gave off a warm feeling. The food was very good! The coffee, however, not the best.   The service was attentive and we never felt neglected for one second.   I don't think they offer valet parking (like many of the other Piedmont Row restaurants), but the garage is right next to Terrace.  All in all, great place and I will be back...just not for coffee.

Terrace Cafe is a great brunch spot.  We stopped in here a Saturday morning/afternoon to get some brunch and of course mimosas.  We you first walk in, you see a bar, some seating on ground level, and then an exposed upstairs which is where we sat.  This place just feels new and clean, while still having some charm to it.       The food here is awesome.  I had the red velvet waffle and the lady had the eggs benedict  The egg was poached nicely, but the red velvte waffle reigned supreme. I honestly wanted to lather my body with the cream cheese drizzle, though I don't know what unwanted person I may attract.      The food, mimosas, and the service were great.  I aso distinctly remember the odd shaped glasses for some reason. The only thing that put me off a little bit is the price.  It was a bit higher for brunch, but you do get what you pay for.  Overall I would definitely return.

Came here for breakfast with my fiancé and my cousins. It was soooo good! The red velvet waffle was amazing! I was hesitant to get it because I'm not crazy about red velvet but I was feeling adventurous. I also got a side of cheese grits with it and it was heavenly as well. One of my cousins got the shrimp & grits and she loved it! On top of the great food, our waitress was really funny and down to earth! I will definitely be back!
We ordered the red velvet waffles and the chef's hash.  Both were amazing unique and very flavorful.

The ambiance was great but the food was horrible. I ordered the breakfast casserole and it was dry and cold in the center. Instead of removing the dish from my bill she asked me to leave a customer service complaint. I highly recommend that you try the other location as this one doesn't provide good customer service.

We went to this restaurant yesterday. The service and the atmosphere were wonderful. The food was also fantastic! I had the chicken and waffles and my friend had the red velvet waffles. Both entrees were very delicious! I really loved everything about this place!

I have visited this restaurant twice now and have gotten the crabcakes benedict.....my mouth jumps for joy when I receive this scrumptious plate of tastiness!!! So good. I can't wait to move on to other entrees. But until then....I'll keep asking for the "crabcakes benedict please !"

We loved this place! My boyfriend and I went there for brunch and the food was amazing. This place is so cute and even has an upstairs overlooking the downstairs. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because the few servers that we came in contact with weren't really that attentive and almost acted as if they had something better to do. Not too pricey but the food is worth it anyways. Definitely would go here again because of how good the food is.

Went here with coworkers after a nightshift and the food was delicious. I had build your own omelette with a side of grits. The omelette was very good, the grits were okay but nothing special. The mimosas were delicious, cost about $7 and were worth it. Great place and we will come back for sure.

I was in the Ballantyne area visiting from San Francisco, CA when I stumbled upon this cafe. OH MY!  I don't think there's enough or even the right words in the English dictionary to be able to describe the delectable flavors of this incredibly tasty restaurant. I ate there FOUR times while I was in the area.   I has the following (not necessarily in this order): - Salted Caramel Mocha with soy milk - Coffee shops of the west coast (specifically SF) please contact the chef for the recipe and let me when you get it! This would replace my beloved long term addiction to Peets Coffee. And that's saying something! If you like salted caramel and chocolate and coffee, this is a drink worth trying.  - S'mores French Toast - I don't think I could ever get this again since it was too sweet for me but despite that, I felt like I was sitting around a camp fire enjoying s'mores. Take a  trip back to childhood and try this treat.  - Garlic Hummus - Had this with co-workers and while we all really enjoyed it, we all agreed it wasn't that garlicky.  - Fennel Pollen Dusted Grouper - This was incredibly good! Although I wish there was a bit more asparagus on the plate but I am sure that's my California self showing.   If you want to take a journey with your tastebuds, check this place out!

Wow, is all that I can say!   I visited here while on a long flight layover in Charlotte.  I journeyed here based on Yelp reviews and I'm glad that I did.   I ordered the Garlic Shrimp Pasta with a side of fried green tomatoes.  My daughters ordered the crabcake benedict and pancakes.   Everything was fresh and DELICIOUS!   The fried green tomatoes were nice breaded and seasoned and not at all greasy, served with a remoulade sauce and pimento cheese (yum!).  The pasta was prepared perfectly, large shrimp, al dente pasta, wilted spinach and diced tomato.  My daughters enjoyed their entrees, including the side of cheese grits and hashbrown patty that accompanied their meals.  We shared the bourbon pecan tart with vanilla ice cream which was absolutely divine!!!

Location: 4/5 Located in the Piedmont shopping plaza, close to the South Park Mall. There's a lot of other restaurants there like Taco Mac so parking can take a little effort sometimes.   Atmosphere / Ambiance: 3.5/5 Pretty simple. Think American diner decor, not too dated or contemporary but not really modern.   Cleanliness: 4.5/5 No complaints. The establishment was pretty well maintained. Minus the RSVP buzzers. I think a couple of them were broken so the host/hostess had to come outside and yell out the names of the parties a couple of times. Not a big deal.  Service: 5/5 Our waiter was really attentive and nice. Water was refilled and orders were taken promptly even with a full house.  Food: 5/5 Biscuit and Gravy - Phenomenal. I mean super delicious. You can get a half order for $3. It's well worth it. (Southern Fried) Chicken and (Red Velvet) Waffle - The potential diabetes is well worth it. I kid. This sweet, savory waffle is amazingly delicious and the perfect combination for the tender chicken breast. A filling brunch for the fat kid in all of us.
Standard line up of foods.  I've been here for business breakfast and lunch.  Nothing exceptional, but ok
This place is finger licking good. A very nice setting and the food us very good! Portions seen to be big. The red velvet pancakes are a must have!
I've been there a few times and enjoy the food and service. The only complaint is that when the restaurant is packed the tables feel very close together.

I love coming here! The wait can be quite long but it's so worth it. The red velvet waffles are everything and I highly suggest the sausage and gravy. I have never been disappointed when I come here. Luckily there's 2 Charlotte locations but so hoping they would consider a third in North Charlotte area.

Great healthy and flavorful options. I need to remember that brrrrr its always cold in there. Pretty noisy for a business lunch but I always end up havng biz lunches here. Must be the killer service and breakfast all day options!

Their bloody marys have bacon!  I love Terrace Cafe for brunch on the weekends! If you love egg benedict dishes you have to try this place. The florentine is my favorite, but they also have a benedict with fielt medallions! Some of their specials include salmon benedict and crab cake benedict. Make sure to let them know how you like your eggs poached...Sometimes they'll come out a little too done.

I'm happy.  This is the first time I had breakfast and now can couple that experience with the many lunches and some dinners here.  All experiences were good.  This is a cafe with a full bar.  Nothing fancy, but it is comfortable with a good menu.  The breakfast was basic with some nice spins.  I had a three egg, must have been small eggs at that, omelet with hash browns and toast.  Juice.  The omelet was just fine, but small and the hash-browns were outstanding rounds of crispiness on both sides.  Bravo!  The surprise spin was strawberry jam, which I first thought was a form of ketchup.  I don't like strawberry jam, but tried this guy and it was terrific.  Just mushed up strawberries with just enough lemon and sweetener to bring out their best.  I must say that I inhaled that jam on a piece of rye bread and it was like dessert.  The waitress, Melanie, told me that they have some other home made jams that they rotate each week or so.  Last week I missed blueberry mango.  Yes, I sure did.  My wife and I especially like their lunches.  Menu has great plates, salads and sandwiches and all meals have fried green tomatoes available.  Dinner menu is not too different from lunch, just a few other main plates.  Nice atmosphere, good for first dates, business meals and simply a place to get fed and have a few drinks...perhaps.  They do a good job and you will like the flatware, glassware and plates. You will see.

I looooove brunch food. Usually our weekends I find myself at the stove making eggs with goat cheese and chives, but today I wanted to be lazy and have the hubby take me out. So we ended up at terrace cafe. From the outside it looks like a small store type place but the indoors is huge with an upstairs loft like feel! We had to wait a few mins so I got a mocha royal espresso athe bar and the huuby got the bloody mary! They were pricey but very yum. Once we were seated, hubby ane I quickly decided on shrimp and grits for him and the full breakfast (eggs, bacon, pancakes, hash browns) for me. The shrimp and grits were phenomanal. I might get the next time. My breakfast was good too....you can't really go wrong with the classics. The star on my plate was definitely the pancakes. Sooo good. All in all a good brunch experience but the drinks are a lil pricey for the size. Will be going back to try other meals.

I went here with my girlfriend a few times now and it is officially confirmed... 5 stars. If you want mind blowing breakfast this is the place. Be ready for a wait on the weekends. The word is out that this place is good because there is always a crowd. Our waitress was great too!! Ask for Savanna she was quick and accurate and always smiling and made our experience all the better! Try the stuffed French toast! Wow!!!

First time here getting breakfast.  Really good!! Loved the three egg mushroom and tomato omelette.  My wife had the scrambled eggs, pancakes, etc.  Loved the fresh squeezed grapefruit juice and coffee. Service was very attentive.

Very good food, good service.  Value, not so well.  Every item I've had there has been of really good quality, but I always seem to come away with a feeling of paying too much for too little.  I'm a guy who likes to eat (uggg, dieting now) and when I find good food I like to have it in decent quantities, I didn't feel like I was getting enough.  Example: I had their burger and fries.  The burger WAS of a decent size, but the fries, not so much.  I work in PTC so this is a place I can walk to, but to be honest, I don't go here for lunch anymore.  The one exception:  Morning coffee/breakfast biscuit $5 takeout special, was a big biscuit with whatever you want in it and a decently sized cup of coffee.  Update 10/28/2013 - I'm growing to like this place more and more, based solely on the above mentioned takeout special.  I get it, this place caters to folks who want a more upscale breakfast, and by all accounts, they deliver.  Their offering of the value breakfast makes the value proposition more.
Food is awesome! Lots of different options including breakfast for any meal! The interior is nothing exciting but the service and food is always on point. Definitely a great spot for any meal.

Service friendly and quick  Atmosphere light but a little noisy.   I had the BLT on sourdough which is a favorite of mine.  I also had the grits that were warm and good and fried green tomatoes. They weren't as good as moms but were very good.   I would definitely come back.

The first time I came here, it was for a Yelp event and at the time I felt the restaurant was five star potential. The service was on point and the food was good. However upon revisiting the restaurant a few weeks later, I can't say I can stand by that initial review. I think the first time I was there the restaurant was ready and was in stage. They had everything prepared. But that's not the way life is. My blended review would be to say the restaurant is a three star. I say that because on top of the wait, it took us forever to get our food. We sat there for 40 minutes with no food in sight. When the food did come out, the avocado put on one of the plates for garnish was rotten. Most of our food were luke warm and the service just want present. I might try this place again but not anytime soon.

Went for breakfast.  Great menu (breakfast served all day).  Nice decor and cool upstairs seating.  Lots of variety on the menu.  The eggs florentine perfectly cooked poached eggs, breakfast casserole was delicious with a little kick to it, but not spicy. Service was attentive and not intrusive.  We will be back for sure.

The good: Chicken & apple sausage. Yum! The bad: VERY limited gluten free options. The waitress wasn't willing to work with me. I ended up ordering off the a la carte menu. How difficult would it be to add a plate with eggs + protein + fruit/side.

Went here for brunch on a late Sunday morning.. There was a long wait (we expected that)... We started out with a Bacon Bloody Mary which was pretty good... After reading all the reviews about the red velvet waffle, I just had to try it. And... I was not that impressed. The waiter told me to try it without syrup which was what I did, it was on the dry side, and not that flavorful. Overall, it was ok.

The wait to be seated for brunch on Sundays can be long, but well worth the wait! I was one of a party of five and we purposely ordered a little of everything on the menu, so we could all sample one anothers' food.   From the red velvet waffle, to the butter pecan waffle with pieces of banana mixed in the actual waffle, to lemon poppy seed french toast topped with fresh fruit, to fried chicken, to chicken sausage, to fried green tomatoes with pimento cheese, to biscuits, to  cheese grits - EVERYTHING was perfectly prepared and taste sooo good!  Don't even think about eating modestly if coming here! Prepare to pig out and to have your taste buds awakened!  Enjoy!

Got the lettuce wraps and bf got the omelette..nothing to write home about.  Service was MEH...but the one saving grace of this restaurant is the red velvet waffle...no syrup is needed with the cream cheese frosting drizzle. So moist yet crunchy I fell in love. Delish!!  I do give this restaurant "props" for it's vegetarian options.

TRY THE RED VELVET WAFFLE AND FRIED CHICKEN!!! This was my first go at at chicken and waffles in the south and I may be ruined for life. I would have licked my plate if I thought people wouldn't stare.  We got seated immediately and our waitress was super friendly and helpful

Today was my second time eating here, and there will definitely be future occasions when I do so.  I normally like to go to a new place every time but this place is so tasty that I decided a return visit was in order.  On my first trip I ordered the monte cristo, which they cut into six small pieces and is simply outstanding.  Today I had the chicken and waffle, which was excellent.  The chicken was very juicy and the waffle is above average.  The coffee is very tasty, and the service is excellent.  My roommate ordered the shrimp and grits which were lovely, and today she had the biscuits and gravy, which were creamy doughy goodness.  I highly recommend this place.

Might just be one of the best breakfasts I've had in my entire life. Everything about our meal was pure passion. My woman had the chicken and red velvet waffles (so good I always had an orgasm) I had the chef's skillet and lemon poppy French toast which put me in heaven

Came here with my boyfriend a few days ago. There was a bit of a wait (~20 min for a table for 2) but it was absolutely worth it. The menu is really big and included options for vegetarians, which I really enjoyed. The place itself was really nice and the service was splendid. My boyfriend had the chicken and waffles which he LOVED and I had an omelette which was amazing as well. If you can ask for the biscuit, which was one of the best parts of my breakfast, simply deeeeeelisssshus.

This place! There were 3 of us in our Saturday brunch party, and we had a 15 minute wait around 1130 am. NOTE - they take reservations, but not for weekends.
