We chose this Piedmont location - great area, not too crowded, and free garage parking literally next to the restaurant.   The place has a super cute, classy feel to it. There are 2 stories, and we were seated upstairs.   My sister got their stuffed French toast and it was unbelievable. Slightly crispy on the outside, soft otherwise, and the filling was delicious. My other sister tried the red velvet chicken and waffles - the waffle was one of the best red velvet waffles I've tried - drizzled to perfection with cream cheese.    I tried the Nasheville hot chicken with the sauce on the side! The chicken was a large, boneless piece and the sauce was perfect - not overly spicy, but definitely with a kick to it. I switched out my side to fries which were probably twice fried, but that much tastier, too!  Service was great and quick! Definitely recommend!!

This was a super disappointment from all of the rage I have heard. Service was slow and your could see multiple employees eating Doritos behind our table "hiding." I was super embarrassed when I brought guests from Raleigh here. I had spoke about how great this place looked. The food tasted like something we could have gotten at Denny's. The hash browns were cold with no flavor or salt. My biscuit was burnt on the bottom and very dry. We had to wait about 30 minutes to be seated on a Saturday at 10:30am. Was not worth the wait at all.

Led astray by The Charlotte Agenda and Yelp. This place was mediocre at best.   Unremarkable food and drink: Flavorless but expensive mimosa, bland crab cake eggs benedict, fine fried green tomatoes. My friend found the shrimp and grits less than edible. Just-okay cheese grits, but The Flying Biscuit has spoiled me there.   Slow and spotty service: We stood in the middle of the restaurant while our hostess checked tables after she already told us to follow her. They were out of Splenda. Didn't bring my coffee until the end of the meal, and had to ask three times for it -- and then again for cream.   Why would people eat here? I don't get it. Sorry I subjected my friends to this subpar brunch.

My boyfriend and I were looking for a place for brunch when he looked up terrace cafe.  I am not big on breakfast foods and was not all to thrilled.  He insisted so we went.  LITERALLY BLEW MY MIND! Everything was delicious from the drinks to the food.  My Bloody Mary was the best thing I have ever tasted,  the peanut butter latte was so delcious we ordered two.  The red velvet waffle was amazing and the steak and eggs we scrumptous! We also ordered brushetta and I highly recommend you doing the same.  The service was also great and friendly.  I will be back!!!!!!!!!!!!

I like to give a place at least 3 chances before I rate them. This place looks and feels nice but the food is worth maybe a third of what they charge for it. Yesterday I paid $15 for runny oatmeal and thin little pieces of Turkey bacon. I've had sandwiches, grits, and of course, on my first visit, the doughy overhyped subpar red velvet waffles. I barely ate half of it, along with a runny omelet. I don't know what all the hype is about. The staff isn't even that great. On a positive note, the food usually looks really good.

Three of us ate brunch here Sunday afternoon.  We came in and were told the wait would be 45 minutes. We waited about 30 minutes to get seated because many people on the wait list had left.  When we were sat we all ordered waters and one person ordered the house Bloody Mary.  Waters came out quickly but the Bloody Mary took about 10 minutes.  When it came out it had no garnish and looked lack luster.  We ordered our food, a Monte Cristo and two chicken sandwiches.  I was really excited about the Monte Cristo because I used to get one at another restaurant but it was taken off their menu.  The chicken sandwiches were described as served with skillet potatoes.  We waited close to 30 minutes for our food.  When it came out they told us it would be a few extra minutes for the skillet potatoes.  My Monte Cristo was so salty it was almost inedible.  The hash browns that came with it lacked any flavor and were more like the consistency of mash potatoes.  The chicken sandwiches were okay at best.  The skillet potatoes came out and also lacked flavor and were sitting in oil.  When the bill came there was an extra dollar charge for the skillet potatoes...that were described as served with the sandwich...and came out late...When we asked about the charge the answer we got was yes they come with the sandwich but there is an extra charge.  Needless to say we were very underwhelmed and will not be back.
My husband and I stopped by on our first trip to Charlotte before we moved here on a recommendation from a friend. The food was excellent and I can't wait to go back and try the red velvet waffle!!

Great service and great food. I am picky with omlets but loved mine with spinach mushrooms bacon and scallions. Also we had the red velvet waffle, strawberry stuffed,French toast and sausage and cheese grits. Haha favorite was the fresh sausage and cheese grits. Try it out!

This was a very poor experience. The menus clearly stated drink specials but manager refused to honor. We have eaten at the Ballantyne location and it's always been good but food here was mediocre at best. All the salad dressings were like custard and the waiter said there was something wrong but never offered to change out meal. Kids meal clearly stated milk was included but charged extra because chocolate milk was ordered.  Worst part was when we told manager about issue with drink price, charging extra for chocolate milk and the salad dressings being bad he could care less.  Being a business owner I would never let a person like him deal with my customers let alone be in charge! Now it makes sense why place was empty while restaurants all around it were busy!
Great food and coffee nice interior and employees

Solid breakfast/brunch place. Be fair warned that its pretty crowded and we had to wait a good 30 minutes be seated at noon on a Sunday. The food was delicious and the service was good as well. Overall I was pleased.
Great food. Loved the omelet and chicken sausage. The coffee cake was awesome!  Our server went above and beyond.  Thank you Joan!

The food here was great! We had their renowned red velvet waffle with fried chicken and Canadian bacon eggs Benedict. The only complaint was the service, it took a while to get seated -so we stood at the door for a couple of minutes-.

Wait was longer than we were quoted, but food was all as good as we had hoped for. Hubby had the red velvet waffle with fried chicken and loved it. I had the steak and eggs and it was cooked perfectly. Our server was fantastic and took good care of us.
Wonderful - French toast was perfect. Only complaint is no butter margarine was used.

During the Holiday season, my family and I enjoyed an amazing meal at Terrace Cafe.  It was my second visit there and I was so excited to take my girls back for a treat.  As with my first visit, the food was phenomenal and the service matched the food.  Our table was well represented with egg dishes and sweet bites...two orders of veggie omelet, a California Waffle, and Blueberry Buttermilk Pancakes.  The coffee is good and the wait staff was on stand-by for refills.  This was a great way to spend some quality family time together.

Get to Terrace Cafe stat if you are a professional brunch'er life myself.  The brunch was delicious.    I've actually been to Terrace Cafe twice.  The first time I got the signature red velvet waffle and chicken.  It was mediocre at best.  Nothing special about the waffle and the breading of the chicken came off as soon as you cut it.  I hate that!  So fast forward to six mos later and my brunch crew decided to go to Terrace.  I was like cool - I hear folks rave about it, lemme give it a 2nd shot.  The french toasts are awesome.  We all got different kinds.  Mine was by far the best.  It was the seasonal pumpkin.  The lemon poppy seed was good, but a little dry.  They have removed the banana nut french toast from the menu.   We inquired about it and were told it was gone, followed by our server saying "everyone asks about it."  So why would they remove something so popular.    So why is this place not 5 stars?  Well I can't forget the mediocre first experience.  I also hate  'no reservations' and the fact that they won't seat you until your whole party is there.  I have a perpetually late girlfriend.  4 of us arrived and waited, and waited and waited...they would not seat us until the 5th got there.  That is an annoyance.  I can understand why, but they'd rather leave those booths empty then seat us.  Here's why I say that.  When girlfriend finally arrived we were seated upstairs in the only tables (booths actually) that could accommodate more then 4 people...well all of the booths were empty.  So my question is why 'hold' them and make us wait in the coffee bar.  Did they think we were lying about having the 5th person?  It just didn't make sense and was irritating.  They also got one of the orders wrong.  Service seemed frazzled. We never had the same server twice actually.

One of my favorite places to have breakfast - from their eggs Benedict to the famous red velvet waffle, everything is delicious and up to par!  I'm not a fan of their grits, but to each his own. This place definitely gets four stars! Atmosphere is comfortable and inviting. Definitely a great eat in the South Park area!

Went there about 3 years ago and it was awesome! Back this weekend and it was Dennys on an smaller location and with higher prices. Service was bad. Empty glasses and dishes were never picked. Zero attention to detail and food quality and taste were not what we remembered from our first visit.

This was, hands down, the BEST breakfast I have ever had in my life!  It has such a hustle and bustle vibe, but not one that stresses you out.  The restaurant itself is warm and inviting, and you can tell that it's owned by good people.  Regarding breakfast, they have a full coffee bar with a bunch of delicious lattes on the menu!  They also have a fun and exciting food menu that has a little (or a lot) for everyone.  There are traditional plates and some that burst with flavor!  I was also really impressed that many things are made in house, like their sausage.  It was delicious!  You may need to wait before you get a table, but gosh it's worth it!

Terrace Cafe is one of the best brunch spots in Charlotte, the wait will be long, but it's WORTH IT. My last three visits I have ordered the banana nut French toast, with extra bananas... I'm not sure why the extra bananas part is so complicated but it hasn't been right any time I've ordered. I've been requesting that the bananas be cooked with the French toast and topped with the syrup dressing, but this just hasn't been the case. I probably will stop ordering this dish but there are plenty others on the menu that will make this brunch experience great.
Delicious food - Great Service at BOTH locations.  Breakfast ROCKS

We came during Sunday Brunch. It was pretty packed. We got seated upstairs, and this was actually my second time here at Terrace. After hearing my parents rave about this place, we decided to go with them and sadly it wasn't the best.  The food was alright, but what really brought our visit down was the service. We literally saw the waitress three times the whole time we were there.  Once to ask for drinks, second for the order, and last for getting our bill. Literally no service at all.   The funny thing was that upstairs, you can sort of see what staff is doing... And let's just say our waiter was having her phone out, watching videos, and distracting other waiters of doing their job...seems like having a grand ol' time. I mean, who wouldn't like that? Go to work, only work a little... And then get tipped? I still tipped, but nothing like what I usually tip.  For food, I got the breakfast casserole. I thought it wasn't bad, but felt like it was missing maybe a sauce as it was a little dry on the outside. Maybe a gravy? I don't know. It was missing something I felt. It came with ketchup, but it didn't fulfill what was missing. It came out like a block straight from a casserole dish, which was what I was expecting, but then when you bit into it... it just tasted dry.

Don't know if it was a particular rough day or normal brunch.  Based on other reviews it seems like they are always busy so that doesn't explain the bartender that had a meltdown while we were waiting to order. He actually threw a lime. Service was great once seated.  Food came out luke-warm and needed seasoning.  Then again prefer that to over-salted.  Might give it another try or maybe not given the many other options in Charlotte.

I am going to start off by saying my experience today was one for the books. The restaurant was very busy so expected to have a longer wait than normal but thats all I expected. Unfortunately that was just the beginning of a bad experience. Our server took our order (Biscuits & Gravy w/ Loaded hash browns and Filet Eggs Benedict). Asked two times for waters still none. Finally the meals come out about 30 min later and my egg yolks already broken w/ English muffin soggy mess served Luke warm. To make things worse the Biscuits & Gravy were cold! Got ahold of mgmt since our server had not checked back in on us since taking order almost 45 min ago...  Matthew Thompson(Asst General Mgr) was very responsive and corrected the situation with a smile - giving us hope again. The food came out hot this time but was missing all the loaded part to our hash browns. He informed us would fix it on the bill and we were happy without it; just too hungry at this point. The food was averaged and felt it lacked flavor - wasn't impressed at all.   This next part is what pushed me over the "edge" to write this review. The General Manager (yes head boss) treated me with such lack of respect as a human let alone a customer of his. I asked him for our check for our server was missing. He handed it to me and I informed him of the issue and the loaded toppings on the hash browns needed to be removed (over $7 charge - no biggie but when told they would felt like it should be done) he then looks at the receipt and say $39 I got this (rude sassy tone) and rips the receipt in my face! The server, hostess and busback couldn't believe  what just happened. I was so taken back I just walked away, got my family and left. I will never never be returning to an establishment that feels it OK to disrespect a customer like that.

This was my first brunch experience in Charlotte and it has yet to be topped. I was really in the mood for some hot chocolate and it was perfection.   We were waiting for a table, but ended up getting lucky and sat at one of the bar tables. I don't think I've ever had a better waiter. He was so attentive, gave us amazing recommendations and genuinely wanted to make sure that we had the best dining experience.   On top of the amazing service the food was delicious. We had the quiche, pancakes, eggs, hash browns, and bacon. Everything was amazing, especially the quiche! I would recommend this place to anyone and often do!

My husband and I were on our way to IHOP when I said let's try something different. I want real breakfast and a real dining experience. The Terrace Cafe didn't disappoint. We found it by doing a google search and said anything beats IHOP. I had the shrimp and grits, my daughter had the egg omelet and my husband had the steak and eggs and we all shared the red velvet waffle which was especially light and yummy! HANDS down one of the best restaurants we have been to since we moved to Charlotte 6 months ago.

Came here for brunch with a coworker. The reviews on yelp and the unique menu selection is what enticed me to try this place out.  The service was good - they seated us right away.  I ordered the infamous red velvet waffles.  They were a little too sweet for my taste, but good.   The atmosphere was homely feeling. It was small, quaint, and nicely decorated.   I would recommend this place for breakfast or brunch. If I'm in the area again, I would revisit this place.

We had a terrible experience here today. Our server was rude and very inattentive. The food was not hot and was not good. While ordering we asked the waitress if they used shell eggs or powdered eggs and she claimed they used real eggs. It was obvious that the eggs were some type of egg beater/powder as the consistency was not those of real eggs. I would not recommend or return to Terrace Cafe. Our waitress was Carley.

Back again as tradition would have it. In town for the Charlotte Cup and the customary celebration feast of coach with competitors.  I am here annually and this time I ordered  just the chicken and red velvet waffle while my company tried buttermilk waffle, lemon poppyseed french toast and shrimp and grits. I could see a few modifications were made on the dishes like the addition of hush puppies and reduction of spicy gravy. Our server was pleasant and service was on point until the food came and my company kept ducking because the food was passed around across our faces and servers reached over our plates instead of around us to the left or even from behind. You lost a star for that because it was obvious we were getting annoyed.

While on our roadtrip back home from Boone, NC we decided to stop in Charlotte for a good breakfast and may I say I was soo pleased with the search results on Yelp. We decided on Terrace Cafe and everyone in my family was pleased with their meal. My husband ordered the eggs benedict with crab meat, although he didnt say much his silence and facial expressions said it all, oh the fact that the plate was clean within minutes. My kids shared and devoured the full breakfast,  which was definitely a full breakfast;  scrambled eggs, bacon,  hash brown and 2 pancakes. And I had the chance to try their Belgian Waffles with fresh fruit which were so delicious, fluffy, fresh, warm and not too sweet. To add to our experience our waitress was very nice and helpful. Oh and service was very quick, we must've received our food within 10 minutes,  which I thought was awesome, especially when you're with a toddler full of morning energy.

Thought it was pretty good.  First time going here after I had heard a lot of great things so I suppose my expectations were pretty high.  That being said I wasn't compelled to come back here with haste.  I had the Chicken and waffles which I found to be just okay.  I did enjoy the mocha though and the also thought the biscuits were above average.  Also kind of expensive for breakfast food, but I'd be happy to pay if it was worth it.  Probably won't be back soon.

Coffee is a 5-star. Service solid. Nice place.  Breakfast very good. Had an omelet which was well prepared with good ingredients. Very tasty. The hash browns were the ordinary shredded potatoes without much flavor. The toast was dry. For a place with an interesting menu with things like a red velvet waffle and shrimp and grits, the sides served with my omelet weren't up to par. The place has a lot of awards displayed around their doors and a large group of regulars that come for takeout before work. The staff knew their standard orders and prepared them quickly for these folks on the way to work. All in all, the coffee, atmosphere and service will keep me coming back but I will avoid the ordinary sides and order the more unique items off the menu.

The food is amazing and the service could not have been better.  We went on a Saturday and were seated quickly at the bar.  The chicken and waffle was great.  We also had the shrimp and grits and the red velvet waffle as well.  Each were wonderful.  The accompanying chicken breast is moist and delicious. If I lived in Charlotte, NC this would be my new favorite place for breakfast / brunch.

Had breakfast at Terrace Cafe last Sunday. I'm glad we got there early ( 9 am ) as a long line was waiting when we left.  Food was delicious and so much that we could not finish.  We 4 should have only ordered 1 order of fried green tomatoes instead of 2.  We had 4 different items and they were all great.  Service was also excellent.  I would definitely return.  French press coffee was not as good as I would have thought  but that's probably because we did not wait long enough.  Also it gets cold quick in that glass pot.

I was in Charlotte visiting and a group of us went here for breakfast and it was great.  The resteraunt is in a nice location and the staff was friendly.  The food was excellent and everything was very fresh also the fried green tomatos are worth a try!

I'm so glad I found this place! It was my first time, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone who likes cute restaurants with good food.  The Good:  1) It's a great location! I am staying at the Doubletree Hilton Southpark and it was maybe a 5 minute drive. I had considered walking, but the forecast called for rain. I don't know why people complained about parking. Yeah, I had to drive to the fourth level of the parking garage, but it was completely free. Especially given the area, the parking situation was great.   2) Decor. It had a cute feel. There was a chalkboard with drinks listed which was cute. I love chalkboards. Also, I sat at the top level over looking the restaurant, so I was able to look at everybody's food and drinks before I ordered.  3) Food. The most important part! It was extremely hard to decide what to eat because I wanted everything (in part because I'm visiting from upstate NY where you can't find chicken and waffles, grits, biscuits and gravy, etc). I decided on the red velvet waffle with chicken, a side of fruit, and a half order of biscuits n gravy. I loved the waffle! It had cream cheese frosting on it. Not much, just enough for sweetness. I didn't even add syrup. The chicken was a little dry, but it had great flavor and was very crunchy. The biscuit and gravy was good. It wasn't salty, but was creamy, the biscuit was fluffy, it was just nice. The fruit was ok.  4) Service. The hostess was nice. I called before  I came, and the hostess was helpful with all my questions. My waiter was just ok. He didn't seem too happy to be there, but he did take back the one item I didn't like (lemonade) and didn't charge me. I will say, though, he was a lot nicer than many other waiters I've encountered in this area.  The Bad:  1) The Lemonade- Since I've been visiting NC this week, I've had much of my favorite fast food, Chick fil A. That being said, the bar is pretty high for lemonade, especially at the price they're charging for it. I expected a fresh squeezed lemonade with real sugar, but I think it was some kind of mix, maybe Minute Maid. It went back.  2) Cupcake Latte- They had several flavors, including Peanut Butter Cup latte, but I've never had cupcake flavor so I went for it. It was plain. It just tasted like a really sweet latte. I'll pass.  3) Dessert- Yeah, I had dessert too (but I got it to go, don't judge!) I got the pineapple upside down cake, which has a layer of cheesecake in the middle. It came cold, which is fine since I was taking it and could heat it later. It's good, and really sweet. The pineapples on top are amazing. But it was $7 for a small slice. Not that I needed a lot, I just feel like it's overpriced.  For the red velvet waffle with chicken and side of fruit, biscuit and gravy side, pineapple upside down cake, and cupcake latte, I paid $31. Not too bad I guess. I really liked the place, so I'd go again.

I've been coming to this place for at least four years, this place is a hidden gem in South Park, the food is always fresh and delicious, breakfast is the best, on weekends it can get busy in the mornings, the service is superb, never had a disappointing meal here, he menu has plenty to choose from. Their omelette is really good, try the spinach and feta cheese. French toast variety is ample, yum yum yum.

Delicious!  Went on a thursday at noon and it was pleasantly crowded.  I had the special, which was red pepper pasta with scallops, and it was heaven!  The scallops were cooked perfectly.  My dining companions loved their lunch as well, the crab cake blt, and the lemon chicken.  I really wanted the spicy bloody mary, but had to go to work, so the waiter brought me a taste of the mix.  It was great, spicy, but not too spicy.  Will be back to have this drink at some point.  Great prices too.

So, it's a Saturday morning and I'm in the kitchen making over-easy eggs accompanied by toast, baby tomatoes and fresh basil and my boyfriend in the living room says, "you're cooking? I thought we could go to brunch." Oh... okay. I never say no to brunch so stopped in my tracks and plated the "breakfast appetizers," considering it a good idea since any good breakfast place in Charlotte seems to have a 20-30 minutes wait.  I was right. We drove down to South Park and put our name in (30 minute wait, as anticipated) and decided to do a little shopping at the Container Store while we waited. We're getting pretty good at fitting errands into dining based on location. Anyway, once 25-30 minutes had gone by we headed back to Terrace, where the hostess was ready to take us to our table. Perfect timing! We were seated upstairs overlooking the restaurant and ordered coffee and fresh orange juice. I had the shrimp and grits (I'm becoming quite the southerner) and we shared a side of the red velvet waffles... OMG. Both were so amazing. I'm not even a waffle person when I brunch, but these were stellar. Also, give me something cajun with a side of okra and I'm a happy girl- big fan of Terrace's shrimp and grits. I left full but surprisingly not feeling TOO full- we still had a lot of errands to run that day. Oh, Saturdays!

I will start by saying this, if you are in a group of 5+ you will wait a while to get sat. Why you say? Let me explain. As we are in town for Memorial day weekend our friends decided to come check this place out, so we just decided to tag along. Get there and wait is already at an hour- hour and a half, which by Atlanta standards is ok to me, so we decided to wait. An hour goes by, nothing, so my friends decide to check with the hostess about 1:15 of us waiting, just to see where we were, to her replying "you still have 15 minutes left to wait"? Huh? What? Isn't that estimated time just an exaggerated amount for us to wait? Or plain leave so you don't have to deal with a large party? As you can tell, the mood slowly started going down hill, and attitudes started flaring. Now, i'm no stranger to waiting, but to tell me how much time i still have to wait? Were you trying to seat us or no? Either way, right at 1hour and 35mins we get called and proceeded to get sat down. Mind you, tons of groups went ahead of us. Either way, we started placing our order to a waitress that couldn't seem to focus, kept looking at us and paying attention to the next table, which she stopped in the middle of us giving her the order to go help the next table, and then coming back. Huh?? Moving on, 35 mins later we got our food; i got the Monte Cristo which was actually pretty good, nice twist with the french toast. Paired with that was some coffee, which I could have been better off with. Tasted more like gas station coffee. At this prices why not have top notch ingredients? Lastly, we paid and got out as quickly as we could. If you have about 2.5hrs to blow just waiting and to quickly eat then this is the place. I don't think i'll make the effort into coming here again. Educate that staff with better customer service practices.

Popping into Terrace cafe during the early afternoon lull on a Saturday was (and is) a good decision. Previous reviews and co-worker experience frequently mentioned THE WAIT during peak breakfast/brunch hours. Thankfully, Terrace serves breakfast all day and I can eat breakfast any time of the day so being there during 'normal' brunch hours really doesn't mean much to me.  We were greeted by multiple staff members and seated immediately upon arrival. We were informed of the drink and food specials of the day and I decided to start off with a glass of pineapple-guava sangria. OHMYYUM. I inhaled this drink, it was so good. I wish I had written down the ingredients in order to recreate it at home...and I wish the glass was bigger.  I had a hard time deciding between the eggs benedict and omelet options so I decided to get some helpful advice from the friendly (and patient!) waiter Ian. I ended up going with the crab cake eggs benedict on a biscuit - per Ian's advice - with hash browns.   While I waited for the food to arrive, I took a peek at the other diners' meals and everyone else (well, it wasn't that many people) was ordering breakfast, usually one of the waffle dishes.   The eggs benedict was delicious! The crab cakes were meaty and the biscuit was a nice touch. I opted for the hollandaise sauce on the side and that was good too. The hash browns were crispy and came out already seasoned with salt + pepper.  This probably had a lot to do with the time of day that I visited but service was so well-paced and friendly. Oh as a random aside, I noticed that they keep stevia in the raw packets on the tables. I happen to use stevia in the raw on a daily basis for my everyday coffee so seeing it available at Terrace made me irrationally happy.  Terrace cafe was delicious and I really enjoyed my time dining there. I cannot wait to go back to try more!

I had the intention on going here and ordering the chicken and waffles... as soon as I saw they offered a RED VELVET waffle, my mind was made up. Red velvet waffles and friend chicken... weird? NOPE! It's a match made in heaven. I got a side of cheese grits and turkey bacon and cleaned basically every crumb off my plate. Also, do not get me started with their chai latte. Absolutely amazing. I swear I still have dreams about my meal, MUST come back very soon. Great service and even better food!!

I hate to do this, but my last few visits to Terrace Cafe have just been ok... certainly not worthy of the 5 stars I gave them a couple of years ago.  During today's breakfast visit, the fella and I sat at the bar. Our server was kind of arrogant and yet didn't know what was in the Berry Split I ordered (my usual). Thankfully, another server overheard him and corrected him. It also took him forever to bring our check, and we finally had to stop him and ask for it since he was too busy talking to the other 3 guys behind the bar.  When I got the Berry Split, it was literally half the size it used to be. There was one, small dollop of yogurt and maybe one banana split in half. Sprinkle on a tiny bit of granola and fruit, and that was it. However, they certainly didn't lower the price; it was still $11! The fella ordered a small OJ, which was $3.50 and maybe 8 ounces. Yikes. His benedict and grits were fine, but there just wasn't anything stellar on this visit or our last few. Pretty disappointing since this used to be my hands-down favorite breakfast in town.

We came for Saturday brunch. Service upstairs was horrible. Looking down it seems that the downstairs service were on point.  The upstairs servers were looking at a video on our server's cell phone, joking around in the kitchen area by the stairs. Our water was never refilled. Coffee was refilled once (it was also cold) by the team leader (I think since she had an earpiece).  We saw our server at our table three times: when she took our drink order, when she gave our drinks and got our food order, and when she finally gave our check. I think we could have just walked out and not pay and no one would notice.    Thinking back to my food, I didn't realize my order was incomplete. I ordered the Southern style Benedict with the optional sausage gravy. The gravy was missing.

Super cute, well decorated restaurant. Was more upscale and put together than typical breakfast places without the stuffiness. Had a cute upstairs seating area as well that overlooked the bottom level. There was also a small bar area too. The parking deck was right beside the restaurant and provided easy parking and access to the restaurant. Also appreciated that they text you when your table is ready.   FOOD:    I got the spicy chicken biscuit with hash browns (I added the peppers and onions to mine for $1 extra). And it was okay. The biscuit was awkwardly large and crumbly to eat like a typical biscuit, would have been better suited as an open face dish. But the flavors were good, was a little spicier than I had anticipated. My boyfriend ordered the full breakfast and absolutely LOVED it. He isn't a huge pancake person but said those were some of the best pancakes that he had ever had!  SERVICE:    The two hostesses at the front were very friendly and gave a very good first impression. Our waitress was nice, and did a good job. Nothing over the top. The manager did come over and check on things, which is always a nice touch. I feel that the manager coming around isn't as common anymore.   OVERALL:   It was a nice, enjoyable breakfast. Will we be back? Yes! Will I order the same thing? No, it was good just not amazing and would like to try some of their signature waffles next time.

Free parking and the garage is RIGHT next door. Friendly, attentive, and wonderful service. Casual, clean, comfortable environment with decent prices on the menu. Food is good, although I can't say much about a belgium waffle and potato hash browns. I wish I tried something more unique to Terrace... I hear the red velvet waffle is one of the most popular... so original! too bad I can't have red velvet.
Excellent food! I went out for a girl's weekend and we all ate off of each others plate everything was so amazing I enjoyed the food thumbs up!

Delicious chicken and waffles!   I totally get the hype of this place, it's very cute with great service and even better food. The waffle was delicious, especially with the soft butter they serve it with. And the fried chicken was surprisingly good-- I'm picky about chicken and am always worried it will be too dry, but this one was really juicy and flavorful.

I'm such a foodie when I travel so I love to look for the awesomest creations when I'm out of town.  I was looking for a breakfast spot on yelp and stumbled upon this place, known for their red velvet waffle.  Yes please!  BF arrived here at almost 9am on a Friday and did not have to wait.  We were hoping to be in and out in less than an hour because we had a flight to catch.  Service was quick and on point throughout the meal.  Not only did they have red velvet waffles, but you could also order it with fried chicken!  So of course I had to get the fried chicken n red velvet waffle.  BF ordered an omelet with a side of fried chicken (one thing I love about the South: you can order fried food anytime of day!). My red velvet waffle was topped with cream cheese drizzle which complimented the waffle well.  The fried chicken was mediocre, but still a pleasant meal nonetheless.  There were a lot of other yummy breakfast options on the menu that looked pretty good too.  I may need to come back if I'm ever back in Charlotte for business.

I visited here for brunch on my last trio to NC. The food was great. I had the red velvet chicken and waffles. A delicious take on the brunch favorite. I especially enjoyed the cream cheese glaze. I also tried the shrimp and grits. Pretty good as well. Although I was pleased with the food the service was not very good. The hostesses did not communicate well during the wait and once inside our food took forever. Our waitress only checked on us one time and for some reason they could not take the okra off the shrimp and grits. The lack of service overshadowed the food.

The red velvet waffle with cream cheese drizzle and fried chicken were amazing! Cheddar grits were so creamy and good. My daughter enjoyed her kid's meal of animal pancakes, bacon and eggs. The restaurant was pretty cold, however. I had long sleeves on and was freezing. Would definitely recommend and plan on going back for the shrimp and grits.
I came for breakfast. Let me tell you their shrimp and grits is freaking amazing!! I would definitely come back and try them out for lunch and dinner.

Neighborhood Gem... You're welcomed by smiling faces and quickly attended by their very friendly  servers ( Maureen, Corrine, Doug and Julie) just to name a few. Of course when they are busy you will have a wait which is well worth it. The menu choices are ample and creative and always satisfying ( Thanks Mark, EC). They are suggestive and always on the money with them. They have consistently fresh ingredients that always come through in whatever you have there. If you happen to be a frequent patron there you will feel welcomed as if you were family and friends each and every single time. Management is present and always checking in on you ( Thanks Mike) and making sure each and every experience is special and a good one for everyone that comes in. Thank you to everyone that makes our experience an AMAZING one every time.

I think everybody in Charlotte already knows how great Terrace Cafe is but I'll still go ahead and remind you. Once again this morning, my breakfast here was 10 out of 10 as well as the restaurant itself and the service.   The food was fresh and it was served very quickly despite how many people that was already there. I had the famous red velvet waffles and chicken, with hash browns. The mimosa was tasted great as well.   All in all, Terrace Cafe is still my favorite breakfast spot in Charlotte.

I always have high hopes for brunch. Checking Yelp beforehand, I decided Terrace Cafe would be worth trying. It certainly did not disappoint.  Terrace Cafe is one of the few places that I know of in Charlotte that does brunch on Saturdays. They also don't take reservations, so expect a wait due to its popularity. I went with my boyfriend at 11:40AM on Saturday and were seated within 30 minutes.  Their bloody marys were good. Warning: the Diablo Bloody Mary was very spicy, but the others were of normal intensity. We ordered the shrimp & grits, chocolate chip waffle, and biscuits & gravy. The shrimp & grits was good, but I wasn't a huge fan of the sauce they had. The waffle was a good cake-y consistency (I prefer it that way). The biscuits & gravy were to die for. And I've grown up in the south my whole life.   All in all, I had a good experience. Food was good, service was quick and accommodating, and the restaurant had a good vibe to its decor.

DO NOT order takeout from this place. The staff is either incompetent or just have zero regard for ensuring customers get exactly what they are paying for. Twice now we've ordered pick up and both times half the order has been wrong or parts of the order were missing.  Each time, our order was read back to us and was correct.  Not sure if the kitchen staff is illiterate or if no one is capable of doing their due diligence of checking orders COMPLETELY before handing them off to the customer but this will be the last time we waste our money here.   The best part, the manager on duty has zero idea how to handle situations like this. He made no attempt to apologize for us having wasted our time and made no attempt to try to keep us as customers. News flash, what your employees do or don't do in our case, reflects just as much on you as it does them.

I've had fried chicken and waffles before but none like this! The Red Velvet Waffle and Fried Chicken is to die for!!! The chicken is seasoned perfectly and the Waffle isn't too sweet! The eggs and everything else are great too! This brunch spot is a must go to!!
Love!! Love!! Love!! This place!! The breakfast is amazing no matter what you order. Service is great and so friendly.

This is a perfect place for burch!!! I came here for brunch for my bday and it was a great start for my new day :)   First of all, very convenient for parking, as soon as you walk out from the parking lot, and it's on the right hand side!!! This restaurant is way bigger then u thought when I see it from outside, upstairs and down stairs wherever you prefer to sit.  The service was great, the waitress was super friendly and sweet!!   As for the main part- food. So I ordered the red velvet chicken waffle with hash brown , then an egg white vegetable omelet with fresh fruit. I have to say what we ordered were just Perfect!!!! The chicken from the waffle was amazing, so crispy and moist, the waffle was phenomenal, really well done, the fruits were so fresh, egg white omelet just so clean and healthy non greasy!!!! Over all, fresh ingredient and perfect cooking just makes me happy:)))

Am I in Heaven?  I think I'm in love with this place.  One of my besties' took me to this place for brunch and that's when I fell in love.  Yeah, I went there for the Red Velvet Waffles w/ cream cheese drizzled on top because it sound intriguing but that wasn't the highligh of my experience.    When we walked into this beautiful establishment, I loved the soft and easy low-key tones of the restaurant.  I felt like we were in a movie.  Although it was packed, the ambiance was very relaxing and comforting.  The star of the show for me was definitely the chicken apple sausage (which is made fresh at the restaurant).  It is so delicious that I am still at a loss for words!  It is definitely something that you'd have to try for yourself.  So let me back up a bit,  I ordered the red velvet waffles, chicken apple sausage, and stone ground grits w/ cheese.   Lately, I have to admit, I have not liked anyone's grits besides my own, but let me tell you...if you're craving grits and you don't want to make them yourself--give this place a try.  I personally cannot wait to go back and try other things on the menu.

We came on Sunday afternoon and the wait was extremely long which is understandable for after-church. We got a cup of coffee at the bar while we waited, but for 2 black coffees it was almost $6?! That kind of set the tone for what was in store. It was very busy, and the service was pretty good. I got the eggs Benedict and they were okay. Ordered the fried green tomatoes as a side. Not sure what spice/s they use, but no one at our table was a fan. We ended up throwing them away, which I so hate to do. Nothing here makes me want to return, unfortunately.
Breakfast here was AMAZING   No need to think about it...just dine here and savor the taste of perfection
Great food and delicious cocktails. Had a coffee infused drink how I wanted it! Absolutely delicious! Ordered the full Breakfast.... delicious! Good costmer service and the food came pretty quickly.
Outstanding Chicken & Waffles!   Only weird thing was the alternative music and town square setting.  Service was fantastic.  Serving sufficient to feed my wife with a to go box.

I've always enjoyed the food. No complaints on that. However today, my wife and I decided to meet there for brunch and the customer service was totally off. I got there first, received my buzzer for our table, and waited like everyone else. Cool. 45 minutes later the buzzer goes off because the table is ready. I turn in the buzzer and prepare to be seated, and I let the hostess know that my wife will be here in 10 minutes or less. She says, oh well I'm sorry but we can not seat you until she comes. Wait, what? Yes, you said there was a party of 2 so you have to wait until she gets here. I asked why and she says its policy and gave me the buzzer back. I waited 5 minutes and had to go back up to the desk. I'm trying to understand why I can't sit down. I said look, I've been standing here nearly 45 minutes and I'm ready to sit down. There is not another party of two, and if I said it was just me you would still seat me at a table with at least two chairs! She says well that's our policy and you already told us its a party of two so I'm sorry! She says look behind you you can sit right... Too late someone's there now! By then my wife walks in and I ask for the manager. Surprisingly, the hostess, Tasha says she is the manager! My wife asks where is your manager then. Tasha says oh he's already gone but there is his card, call him! It won't change anything! I said you know what, I'm hungry so let us eat so we can go. I'll just call the owner. She says well his name is Stuart and he lives upstairs! I was pretty pissed and it took everything in me not to be disrespectful back, but once seated we did call the manager Patrick I think. I'm starting to believe maybe she was right because although he apologized and said Tasha was wrong, I don't feel as if it was handled correctly. Very disappointed in this service today! Gotta do better to loyal customers!!!

Wow, I've been busy and I haven't had a chance to do this review like I wanted to.   My boyfriend and I went to Charlotte for a day trip & found this place for a brunch before we hit the road. It was Sunday, therefore we alreeeeady knew it was about to be a wait. What is convenient for this location is that rug parking garage is right next to it. Therefore, if you're with someone, drop them off so they can get a table then park and come back down. For our wait, we did the text message system and I thought that was very savvy. We were told we had to wait 25 minutes. We ended up waiting around 40. It's brunch, what do you expect lol?  I always enjoy looking at the menu prior to me sitting if there's a wait. Like why .. wait to get waited on when you were already waiting. This location had a menu on the outside of the building which helped speed the process up.   As we were waiting I saw that this restaurant had won awards. So in my mind, their bar just raised. When you walk in there was a bar where you can order your fun drinks and pick up your togo orders.   I feel like one of my favorite parts of the restaurant was how we got to sit upstairs. We got to look over the. .. wait for for it. .. TERRACE LOLLLL.   Our waiters name was Brandon. He was pretty cool. While ordering, he actually made me excited for the food. We waited, not very long actually. I ordered banana pecan french toast with a side of hash browns. YES CARBS.   The toast came but I had to wait almost 10 minutes for my hash browns. I was a little disappointed. Why? Because I like eating everything I ordered at ONCE... and well. . I like taking photos of my food & it was missing lol. When I got the hash browns I was little. .. ehh idk. It didn't have annnny type of seasoning. They were bland. The french toast was a yes and my boyfriend didn't have any complaints about his food.   So it's time for us to leave & we needed to use the restrooms. If you have read any of my previous reviews, bathrooms are a big deal for me. To me, they are a reflection on the cleanliness of your kitchen area. An example, yes the kitchen can get chaotic, however for safety concerns, they need to be managed to make sure that the health and safety is kept up. . whaaaaale. . the bathrooms at this location weren't "everything".  There was barely any tissue and it was "placed" on top of the roller when clearly, you could just place it. .. alright anyway. Stuff was all over the floor, etc. I understand that yes it's brunch, yes it's a weekend, yes it's busy. . however there needs to be someone checking it more often when the traffic is higher in the restaurant.    Overall rating: 3.5.   Pros:  - service, GO Brandon  - atmosphere  - quality of food   Cons: - bathrooms  - prices for side items  - no seasoning on the hash browns - food was "forgotten" and had to wait.   I know for a fact that when in the area again, we will be back.

If you have never experienced the red velvet waffle, you should! I have been here a handful of times and am never disappointed with anything that I have gotten! I've had there red velvet waffle with cream cheese drizzle...its amazingly light and fluffy and so flavorful. I also have had there Eggs benedict florentine. Its so good too, the hollendaise sauce has a whole-grain mustard in it which gives it a unique flavor. And last there bacon bloody mary is wonderful! What's not good with bacon in it... The staff is always friendly and the food never takes a long time. I recommend making a reservation though if you go on the weekend. They get busy, fast! This place is just plain good. I can't wait til I go back again! -SK

It was good, but I didn't think it was anything special. Was it worth the wait? Not really, but I'm not saying it was horrible. Just not a place I would recommend. On the bright side, our waitress was nice.
The food is amazing here, I had the shrimp and grits with a velvet waffle and it was delicious. Our server Julie was also amazing.
Honestly not the biggest fan of the famous velvet waffles, I prefer the breakfast bowls. The brunch food is great and I've eaten here 3 times. Never had any bad service. Would return and recommend

Love this place whenever I'm in town. The hostesses were rude when we walked in and we're more interested in their conversation than greeting us. The waitress was nice. Chicken and red velvet waffles were delicious, but not as good as I remember. I feel like the chicken portion has gotten smaller since my last visit. The cheese grits were great.

Very family friendly! That counts for a lot in this house. Breakfast is the only meal that we actually attempt to eat out with 3 preschoolers. Last week, the wait on a Sunday morning was almost 45 minutes but once we were seated our server was incredibly prompt and attentive. I was most impressed when my 2 year old ordered a hot chocolate and they brought her a mildly tepid version - kudos for that! The kids menu is simple and priced right - $5. They added chocolate chips to the kids pancakes for$.50. The kids' meals all came with a huge dish of beautiful fruit. My husband ordered an omelet special and it was fantastic. I ordered the banana pecan French toast and it really was too sweet for my taste.  Today we had no wait but the service was slightly less fantastic. My husband was served coffee with no cream or sugar and our salt shaker was empty. Our food was excellent but I was ready to bus my own table at the end because my kids were so antsy and the check was nowhere in sight. My husband finally had to give in and just take the kids out while I waited for the check. Still our fave breakfast place - will probably be back soon!

Terrace cafe has been one of my favorite brunch spots in Charlotte, but this week, I had the pleasure of sampling some of Terrace's new dinner menu, and thank God....grits are included!! I've always loved the grits here; they aren't to soupy, not too grainy and they are now a part of a shrimp and grits dinner menu item. I also had an interesting salad that included two colors of beets and a very delicious dressing. To top it all off , I enjoyed a gluten free peanut butter cheesecake that was so good I lost track of time eating it, zoned out a little.

Umm so yea! This is definitely the spot for breakfast if you're in Charlotte. I was between the chicken and waffles, French toast & egg white omelette. I decided to go with the poppy seed lemon French toast w/ a side of fried chicken. Most definitely worth it, plus a cappuccino!  The terrace had a cozy vibe & customer service was awesome. Can't wait to go back, we need places like this in Raleigh!

Hands down, this is a favorite breakfast spot! Red velvet waffle is too yummy!!! The pricing is fair and the service is good. On the down side, there us usually a long wait - especially on weekend mornings and the coffee bar isnt that great.

The food was okay, not great. I ordered the terrace biscuit, and I love biscuits but in my opinion this was too much biscuit, I wish they would've used a more equal portion of biscuit and egg. My husband got the stuffed monte cristo, he also said it was only okay. Our little girl got the spice donut dunker, and she didn't eat it. It had way too much spice in my opinion. The coffee was good, and the waiters were excellent. We sat at the bar and everyone was super nice, me and my little one were drooling over the fruit, one of them handed us each one. I also liked how attentive the staff was there. However, my husband dropped me off at the front so I could reserve a seat, I was told you cannot reserve until your whole party is there, which I can understand. I stepped to the side and waited for my husband and daughter. Two minutes later, another woman walked in, and I don't know if it's because she was white but they were ready to seat her even though she had clearly said a party of 4 (she was alone). The hostess saw me glare at her and set the menus back down, then proceeded to tell her the same thing. Because of this reason we chose to sit at the bar, and because of this reason I will not be going back.

I'm a big fan of Terrace Cafe and the secret seems to be getting out. I went a little early and put our names in, so we were seated almost as soon as the rest of the party arrived, but I heard wait times of up to 45 minutes quoted and people were actually staying! What does that tell you about how yummy their food is? That people are willing to wait & have a morning beer at Taco Mac just to eat there? Worth waiting for!  Anyway, I went for brunch with 3 other ladies and we all found something that sounded (and tasted!) excellent. However, I think I've written before about how good their food is, so I will take this opportunity to highlight their coffee. I never thought of them as a place to go specifically for coffee, but wow, they have upped their game on that front. My latte was perfection and one of my friends called her cappuccino "the best she'd ever had." Yum, will return. :D

Randomly stopped in for a quick breakfast.  Had the Southern Sausage Benedict.  Basically an Eggs Benedict with sausage in place of ham and a biscuit in place of the muffin.  The biscuit was a little dry, but the meal was tasty.

Terrace Cafe is a neat spot tucked into the base of a mixes use residential/office building offering breakfast, lunch, and dinner menus. The decor is inviting with bar, ground, and upstairs seating options. By all accounts the waitstaff was very helpful and the entire environment was very warm.   We stopped into the Terrace Cafe for breakfast. The menu is varied and it offers a nice selection. We had a couple of omelette's and the shrimp and grits. The omelette's were stuffed to perfection and prepared perfectly. The portions were generous and the house made jam was amazing. Being from Pennsylvania, I have no clue what good grits are or how to prepare grits but these were fantastic. The dish was spicy, and the texture and consistency seemed spot on. The coffee was good and they were quick to refill.   The only slight downfall is price. You are getting quality food so the price for breakfast  is going to be a little more than traditional breakfast spots. If you are like me, and do not mind, check it out. Overall, the Terrace Cafe was a really fantastic breakfast spot and I would love to check it out for other meals.

I've always had a great experience when I go to Terrace. It's one of my all time favor brunch spots! I love their red velvet waffle and chicken!! I get it just about every time I go for brunch. I've also had a breakfast drink...kinda a spin on the mimosa....there but I can't remember the name of it. It has grenadine and pineapple juice though and it's delicious! I've had their fried green tomatoes and they were very tasty as well. Honestly, I've never had anything that I didn't like at Terrace.

The atmosphere was very welcoming and it was jammed packed on a Sunday for brunch but the wait wasn't long and the food was delicious! I ordered the red velvet waffle and fried chicken and it was delicious!!!

First time at the Terrace Cafe and I can say that it definitely live up to the hype.    I am rather discerning about my desserts and red velvet is my favorite however I rarely find a really good red velvet anything. With that said, the red velvet waffles were amazing.  Light and fluffy; kinda opposite of how a red velvet cake or cupcake is but it works.  It is flavorful and the cream cheese icing is as light and perfect.  I am extremely impressed.    The shrimp and grits was delicious and savory.  I only had a bite but will definitely order it on another occasion.    I may not be a connoisseur of fried green tomatoes since I am not a Southerner and thought these were alright. I probably wouldn't order them again.  If you are in the Queen City, definitely make the time to come to the Terrace Cafe! A must stop on your culinary path.

Terrance Cafe is such an awesome place. The staff is very welcoming and the restaurant is inviting. I thought it was so nice that they had upstairs seating which overlooked the whole restaurant. Although this place is known for their brunch I ordered from the lunch menu. I order some type of fried chicken and veggies. My brother ordered the same thing but subbed the veggies out for a salad. When my brother got his check the price of subbing the salad was the full price of the salad. When asking the Server about it she took off $2. The portions aren't very big so if you have a big Appetite like myself this may not be the place for you. Over all the food was good along with the service.

Very cute place in the cut. Drive past it all the time and never went. My sister brought me and said the food was amazing. Everything was good from the food to the service. My sister ordered hot tea and it was so good(peach). Across from the mall under some apartments(or maybe condos). Chris was so nice and very attentive. I had the chicken and plain waffle. Loved it. I ate it all. Didn't like my hash browns though. Tasteless. Everything else was delicious. It was 29 for both of our meals. Not bad. Def worth it. Everything I saw coming out of the kitchen looked great. Def will go back. Parked across the street at ENT office(so not sure about the parking). Came after an appointment. No wait. Sat ourselves at the bar. Was after lunch time so it wasn't too busy.

I was very excited to dine at Terrace Cafe, from family members raving to Yelp hyping it seemed like it was going to be awesome. Perhaps my expectations were to high? No, perhaps I should have went for breakfast? Probably. I ordered an appetizer of fried green tomatoes and pimento cheese. They came out very hot and crispy with tons of flavor, easily the best part of my experience. My main course was the trout, veggie rice pilaf and tempura green beans. The food was by no means bad but it also wasn't anything memorable. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing because my friend loved his steak. I left feeling very underwhelmed, sucks when the appetizer is more exciting than main course. Whenever I return it will be for breakfast.  PS - you would think that a classy restaurant could offer a better beer selection than boring bud, coors and miller. Sure they had Sierra Nevada and Fat Tire but that was it. Beer is just as, if not more complex than wine, recognize.

Terrace Cafe is a solid lunch place! I've been there a couple of times and the food has never, ever been bad.   The restaurant is very well lit and has two stories so there is plenty of space. I'm not usually a salad person, but I haven't had anything else from there... their oyster salad (both Caesar and Spinach) are very good! I look over the menu and want to pick something different, but every time I end up getting the salad.   The service is good so overall I'm pretty happy going there for lunch. I've heard their brunch is even better though! I'll have to try it soon.

The service was very slow...but the WORST thing was this new policy they have about charging your credit card with a service charge. I was celebrating my sons graduation from college with my entire family and they gave me an additional service charge for using my credit card. The Terrace Cafe claims that many resturants are now doing it...I have never seen any resturant charge for using a credit card to pay....and there was no sign posted anywhere. Warning, before you go to the Tarrace Cafe, be aware they will charge you extra for using your credit card. I will never go there again.

The food here was amazing ! Came out to Charlotte for a girls getaway and found this restaurant on Yelp! My friend and I decided to trip it out and was not disappointed. The first day I had the red velvet chicken and waffle with a side of hash browns. The one thing the set the waffle apart was the cream cream drizzle !! It was delicious. The chicken was cooked to perfection as well. My friend had the shrimp and grits ( which by the way was pretty good as well . I tasted some of hers. Nice flavor ) we decided to go the the restaurant the next day since it was close to our hotel and I had the chicken and biscuit with ghost pepper pimento cheese and jalapeño jam. Instead on placing the cheese and jam on the biscuit I asked for it on the side so I can place it on myself. However, the ghost pepper pimento cheese and that jalapeño jam on that chicken and biscuit was the right call!! It was one of the best chicken and biscuits I had .. ( chicken was cooked just right and the biscuit was good ) but it was the added extra that made it what it was !!! The server was very attentive and friendly even for a weekend. The place was extremely busy . If I ever visit Charlotte again I am going to make sure I come by this place!!

We ordered the Velvet Waffle.  It was Oh boy super delicious.  It was cruchy outside and soft inside so perfect.  I can eat about 20 of their waffles in one meal no problem.  The price is reasonable average about 10 dollars per dishes.  The seating is so cute, upstair and downstair.  On the upstair, they set up as a terrace so u could see thru the down stairs.

First time at Terrace.  We met some friends for Brunch and it was great.  Had the Chicken and Waffles with Fruit with a side of Hashbrowns.  Everything was great with the exception of the fruit.  Just disappointed in the quality.  Otherwise everything was perfect.  Will return.
If you leave here after breakfast and are able to eat lunch, you are not human. Food is wonderful here and very filling from all sorts of breakfast options.

Whenever I say Terrace Cafe, someone always goes "ooo I heard that place was good" or "omg that place is so good!" I have recommended the place to many ppl. Just be warned, there is always a wait, especially for Sunday brunch.   The food I have had and not one has let me down:  Chicken and waffles Red velvet waffles Steak and eggs Shrimp and grits  Chicken burger French toast Chicken wings  Service is always exceptional as well.

So, I was down in Charlotte for a couple days for a wedding.  The hotel I was staying at had an overpriced, lackluster breakfast buffet, so I decided to venture out to find food elsewhere.  After reading the reviews here on Yelp, I headed to The Terrace Cafe.  Normally when I'm in a strange town, I never eat at the same place twice as I want to try as much of the local scene as possible.  But after going to the Terrace Cafe on the first day, I decided to break this rule and head back on the second day.  On the first day, my wife and I were quickly seated.  She ordered the SEC breakfast sandwich, and I ordered the Belgian malted waffles.  Seth, the waiter, said to me "Do you like bacon?"  Which I replied "I'm a guy.  Of course I like bacon."  He then told me that I should try the bacon waffle.  I decided to give a shot.  Now, Seth made it sound like the Bacon Waffle was better than sex.  Poor guy looked so disappointed when I told him it was "pretty good" (That really is a very high compliment from me.)  So, Bacon Waffle not better than sex, but definitely amongst the top breakfast's out there.  Wife enjoyed her SEC as well.    The next day, more relatives arrived for the wedding and we decided to head back to Terrace Cafe, but this time with a group of 8.    Again, we were sat very quickly, and Seth even remembered the wife and I from the day before.  I went with the more traditional Eggs Benedict, and Wife had an omelet.  The eggs benedict were the best I've had in quite some time (It's amazing how the hollandaise sauce can vary so much from restaurant to restaurant.)  Wife thoroughly enjoyed her omelet.  Now, as if the main breakfast entrees aren't enough to get you to come to Terrace Cafe, Then consider their sides.  I had their hash browns both days.  Pure fried shredded potato goodness.  Wife had the fruit cup, which she said is the best fruit she's ever had at a restaurant as it included some more exotic fruits.    I wish we had one more day in Charlotte as I really wanted to try the red velvet waffle.  Someone at the table next to us on the first day had it as a breakfast desert (seriously, they both had eggs benedict, which is quite filling, then split a red velvet waffle afterwards.)  I recommend this place for anyone in the Charlotte area.  It's traditional southern breakfast with a modern twist.
We went for brunch and got an omelette and a quiche. The food was pretty good. I would definitely recommend making reservations since it was very crowded.

I came here on a Saturday morning with my girlfriend for breakfast for the first time. The service was great.. since it was a Saturday morning I was expecting a long wait but that didn't occur...we were seated immediately and within 5 minutes we were greeted by our waiter...our food came pronto once we order and everything was really tasteful.. I enjoyed my blueberry vegan waffle.. vegan chorizo sausage paired with a pineapple mimosa..prices were in reason and great proportions. I will for sure come back here for another meal
Good breakfast, and a great place and you get a lot of food, just wish they chicken wings. Lol

I found my new brunch spot and it feels so good! My original brunch place all the way in the Plaza but totally worth the drive has gotten a bit too repetitive so while enjoying dinner one night at Piedmont, stumbled on this place. Super cute inside, friendly staff and aaahhhh yes, the sunday wait line. No problem, get yourself a latte and sip away until your called to the table. The food is so good, you wish you knew about it sooner. The eggs benedict floentine is my favorite. The french toast with creme bruele butter is so good you want to ask for more butter to go. The too have the apple butter sauce my original location carried (I thought it was signature mark, guess not, its bought by a bigger vendor). I can't wait to go back on Sunday!

Definitely worth the wait! Red velvet waffle or the lemon poppy seed French toast is a must! Sometimes the wait can be long but if you are willing to wait it out, go outside your comfort zone and try one of their signatures.

I've had this place bookmarked for a while now, and I finally decided to check it out with my wife. After seeing all of the glowing reviews, I thought it would be a sure hit. It wasn't.  There's tons of close, free parking in the attached garage, so that makes getting here very easy. You can expect quite a wait. Ours was 45 minutes to an hour. Since it was cold outside, most people waiting just lurked around the tables in the lower level, which would bother me if I were dining there. On the plus side, the outdoor waiting area had a nice propane heater, so we were able to wait, stay warm, and avoid lurking.  The decor is reminiscent of a late-90's hotel buffet eating area. Upstairs, where we were seated, features low-hanging pipes and unsightly, painted flexible ducting that is draped precariously over pipes. Not a great ambiance, methinks.  The food was good overall. I ordered the Crab Cakes Benedict, and my wife ordered the Canadian Bacon Benedict. She got a side of hashbrowns, and I got the cheese grits (upcharge). The eggs were perfectly cooked, and the English muffins, although they looked pretty thin, were very tasty. The cheese grits were good, but they were a little cold and were served in a tiny dish. Bummer.  I have to think that this place used to be something much, much better. At this point, most of the glowing reviews from a few years ago should be considered very, very misleading. Given all of the great brunch choices in CLT, I don't think I'll be back for a second visit any time soon.

I looooooove the Terrace Cafe! The only downside is the ridiculous wait on Sundays (often 1/2 hour or more with almost non-existent seating for the amount of people who are waiting).  The food is so delicious and I HIGHLY recommend their coffee drinks - I always get a Black and White (which I think is a regular mocha and a white mocha combined).  A+ (but seriously, guys, figure out a way to make the wait less crazy -- maybe a bigger location?)

Went to Terrace Cafe for lunch and had an excellent experience.  Portions were large and filling and service was excellent.  The Shrimp and Grits is definitely a great menu item.  The Steak salad is a more than generous portion.  I would recommend this to anyone...each time I go, I have a good experience.    Service was excellent as Matthew did a phenomenal job.  A manager even stopped by and was very pleasant as well.

Disgusting. Seriously the chicken and waffles are chicken tenders and waffles. The hash browns are so nasty they taste like the smell of the hotel glasses they keep in the room. Musty! Yuck never again. No wonder ppl from Charlotte think it's good because Charlotte has some of the worst food I've ever had. I'm a northern we have real food and real restaurants. I won't come back nasty! And my waitress never checked on me either. So terrible service so disappointed

We came to Terrace for a Monday brunch and were left with a mostly average experience. I ordered the Stuffed Monte Cristo and my SO ordered the Chicken and Waffles.   The Monte Cristo was on the soggy side - so it made the sandwich hard to eat. The portion was huge, but the sogginess hurt the overall experience.  The Chicken & Waffles were great! They come highly recommended, especially if you pair it with their famous Red Velvet Waffle. However, the side of hash browns we both got were really disappointing. They were only crisped on one side, so the interior of the hash browns were soggy.  Get the chicken and waffles - but otherwise, look elsewhere.
Have yet to try their brunch but hear it's exceptional. Only complaint is the breakfast sandwich was a bit dry. Salads are awesome, great iced tea & service is exceptional. Very cool vibe.

Went to an early breakfast and had the red velvet waffles. As you can tell by all the pictures they are outstanding!! The omelette looked really good as well. I really don't think you can wrong with whatever you order here :)

I met a friend here for lunch on a Wednesday and while I had been in the Piedmont Town Center for Taco Mac, I had never been here!  She had suggested it, raving about their brunch on Sundays, so it sounded wonderful.  The atmosphere is quaint and lovely, charming in a "brunch-ey" kind of way.  We were seated quickly and the lunch crowd was already in full swing.  Our server was prompt and attentive and didn't rush us, which was nice because we were catching up, leisurely.  I ordered the buffalo chicken sandwich with a side salad with balsamic vinaigrette.  My friend ordered the BLT with extra bacon and fries.  My sandwich was delicious, although I asked for the blue cheese sauce to be put on the side, as I am more of a ranch dressing kinda girl.  Glad I did....the blue cheese sauce (or fondue as they called it) was too overpowering for the delightful breading and tasty wing sauce on the chicken.  I dipped it in ranch and was quite happy!  The salad was yummy, although the dressing was too oily, so I would suggest sticking with the ranch, as it was delicious!  I sampled my friends' fries and they were quite nice, too!  Overall, I would like to come back for the brunch here, as the red velvet waffles sound to-die-for!

I always enjoy my visit. I took the kiddies and they enjoyed the chicken and waffles, pancakes and fruit, while I had the shrimp and grits. The space is little small, the staff is friendly it seems depending on who's your server that day. Overall the food is always good.
Red velvet waffles,  Crispy bacon  Yummy grits  More menu items to try later  They did struggle mightily with my basted egg request.

If you can't tell from the large amount of reviews or the weekend crowds, this place is fantastic. On the weekends during regular morning/brunch time, be prepared to wait for awhile. They don't really take reservations or call-in advance during those times. But trust me it's well worth the wait. Whenever a friends visit from out of town, I make sure to bring them here. The food is delicious!  My personal favorite the lemon poppyseed French toast. Friends have raved about the chicken & red velvet waffle and the crab cake Benedict.  Just writing this, I'm craving some terrace cafe!

This place always has a wait on a sunday.. at least an hour but it is well worth the wait.. there brunch is amazing. I always get the red velvet waffle which is soooooo delicious. They also have the shredded has browns which is my all time favorite hash browns. The shredded ones are the best kind. We just went and they had a special for pumpkin waffles but by the time we got in they had already run out which was a bummer. My fiancee got the grits and he said they were also amazing

At terrace cafe its become so popular that there's a wait! What a great problem to have. I would say the quality of the food is still top notch, the hospitality is really good and the service is good. If I had to say anything negative its the fact that this particular visit we didn't receive place settings until our food came! Thats all! This is a great spot for brunch!
Best brunch in Charlotte hands down! Super packed on Sundays! I love their breakfast choices!

Food: I ordered the Shrimp & Grits (gluten free) and it was a life altering experience. I walked into Terrace as a broken man. The Shrimp & Grits put me back together   Service: very friendly despite how busy they were   Will I come back? YES

Consistently good food here. I've only had the Belgian waffle, chicken Apple sausage, grits or hash brown and everything is good. The mimosas are pretty good as well. Waits can be looong on the weekends, so be prepared for that.  There is a small bar upfront and you can order coffee or espresso while you wait.
I went her for lunch with a friend not really knowing what to expect the restaurant is clean and service is good the food is forgettable to me though I might have just ordered the wrong thing
The Bananna Nut french toast is to die for my bacon was a little cold and the eggs were fried too hard but other then that the service was good

Food is decent but expensive for what you get.  Consistently very busy.   If you work in Piedmont Town Center and you have to eat real food quickly before your next meeting, Terrace is a great option. If you're not in a huge rush, there are better options (both in quality and in price) within a few minutes drive.

My family and I visited this place about a week ago for Father's Day, and we were expecting it to be really good from the pictures/reviews I saw, but it turns out it was overhyped.  To begin, I would lie to start with the service. Since it was Father's Day, we were expecting it to not be the greatest service, which is totally fine. However, our first server seemed to have no interest in us whatsoever, and he made some poor, overworked server take his place instead. Our service from this next server was decent, probably because she had so many tables to staff. Also, when our food arrived, we had no utensils on our table, and we waited a good five minutes before any utensils were brought to us (by the way, my Dad had to get up and find someone instead of just waiting even longer for our server to show up).   Now for our mediocre food. Everything but the lemon poppyseed French toast was just "meh" food. I ordered the Bavarian creme French toast sticks, which sounded good, and they actually okay apart from the very oily taste from them being deep fried and there not being creme in the whole French toast stick. The other dishes we ordered that were just okay as well were the full breakfast and eggs Benedict. Not only was the full breakfast overpriced for what it was, but it did not come as ordered either. Not to mention, my dad got food poisoning from it as well (on Father's Day!:( )  Overall, the only good thing about this place was the lemon poppyseed French toast.

You simply can't beat this place for breakfast. They have great eggs Benedict. Service is always been fast and good. Parking looks like it's going to be trouble but it's not. All you have to do is park in the parking deck. I've never had an issue.

Love this place. Everything is delicious. The drinks are amazing. The orange juice makes me never want to drink any other orange juice. And they have this blueberry jam or maybe blueberry peach. It is uhhh-mazing.

I was expecting to be thoroughly impressed and I have heard so many great things about their Red Velvet Waffle. I went this past Sunday for brunch with a friend. And it was just okay. First of all the red velvet waffle just tasted like a regular waffle, it needs more cocoa in their batter to give more of a taste. At least their cream cheese syrup wasn't too sweet. Their hash browns could have used some seasoning. And the fried chicken, is really a chicken breast cut in half and battered and fried. I have had better brunch at the Cheesecake factory, Bistro La Bon, 131 Main, and Pike's Place. It just boggles my mind that there are so many good reviews when their food is just average. Also we ordered a hot chocolate and vanilla latte. The hot chocolate was just water with some cheap cocoa powder, I could have made a better hot chocolate with my godiva cocoa powder mix and the vanilla latte you could just taste a cheap vanilla abstract. I am not trying to be negative I am just keeping it very honest so others will not get disappointed like me. However, the wait staff was great.

Love this restaurant so much! It is consistently delicious every time and the staff are so friendly! It's a lovely environment and it is always a pleasure to visit. Lastly, do NOT forget to give the red velvet waffle a try! It is amazing!

So many of my friends have told me of this place.  I went today for the first time!!! Wow! All the Food looked so amazing and it taste Great!!  We were seated quickly and they were very welcoming, however the Food I loved the flavor and it taste delicious tried to eat it but it was cold :( even after we sent it back still came back cold  I was sad because I ordered the Caramel Apple French Toast "it was cold and my cheese eggs where ok except they were cold so the cheese didn't really melt. Didnt get the full French Toast  you get 2 for $11 to add eggs is $4 to add cheese is  $1  .. it was all cold.. kitchen at the door,,,, plates at the window ppl sitting waiting to eat waitresses talking and not helping each other push food out to customers is why my food was cold! They are a great business and Food is A++++++ but it was cold because they were not helping to push the Food out to customers"  Experience

Red Velvet Waffles. S'mores French Toast. I love how when it comes to breakfast, you can add tons of junkfood to any staple and suddenly it's a perfectly acceptable meal. It's like calling something a muffin instead of a cupcake...no guilt when you eat your non-cupcake at 7:30a.m.   Thanks to the fabulous Yelp reviews we used the occasion of out-of-town friends passing thru CLT as an excuse to head south and meet the fine people at Terrace.
